tSNzBsM3Bftia7SYWdvmXg.text: First I need to say that the foods and services were EXCELLENT. It is definitely a place where you go when your company is paying because the Entrees were all in $30+ range. However, I ordered Ahi Tuna Skewers from Small Plate section and it was delicious and enough for me especially when combined with my Crab Cakes appetizer.   The ambiance of the resturant is very masculine with dark wood paneling and Men's club type decorations. Not a place for a romantic dinner unless you're planning on talking about your Pre-Nup arrangement. If you're dining out with your business associates over 40 years old, this is the place to go.  Two of my colleagues ordered Steaks and said that they were cooked perfectly.

StfFS4H_guzWwy95B0uiNA.text: Been to the one in Phoenix, Newport Beach and now this one in Charlotte, consistently good. Good service, good atmosphere.

WO7zl7CPTFwGLVTDX7PJxA.text: Cool bar, and nice bartendars. They have about 100 wines that you can order by the glass. Also the bartendar can make a mean martini and old fashioned. Food was amazing and the filet was tender and delicious. A little oscar style as well for the added final touch. Right near my hotel the Aloft so its right there. Always get a good meal and drink at Flemings in Charlotte. Will be back!

QDV2EBGxGNsUFg5JuVcobQ.text: The wine list is insanely large and great. They even give you a iPad with the wine list on it. The food was pretty good for a steakhouse. I say that because usually steakhouses don't stand out for me but in this case, it was quite good and the waiters were attentive and nice.

b8E1VgIaXtnXhNiWVe69ew.text: Seriously overpriced drinks. Insultingly so. I could drink cheaper at the capitol grill and find better food ambiance, and bartenders. Shame on the management and owners. Great happy hour food but not worth the 37.00 for two titos and tonics.  75$ bill for french onion soup,  a burger and fries, two vodka tonic doubles in a sad and pathetic little glass and two glasses of house chardonnay.

38ljgTMbZj8aCe1uWiK-Jw.text: My family and I had dinner here tonight during Restaurant Week. Our thinking was that we could try it to see if we liked it enough to warrant going back. What a disappointment!!! I would HIGHLY suggest not going here during Restaurant Week, which is a shame. The portions appeared to be smaller than usual, the room was overcrowded, food quality suffered, and our service was not great either. I doubt I will be going back to this restaurant and would NOT suggest it. I will expand on all of the above...  I have a feeling their food quality suffered from normal bc of the lower prices and higher demand/levels of customers during rest. week. My NY Strip was tough, and not warm when I received it although it was cooked properly/as requested (med. rare). I have had much better steaks at much less expensive places. Calamari appetizer was overly tough and the portion size was humorous. Ice cream for dessert?  Should have passed. VERY poor quality on the ice cream and my wife's cheesecake was no different. My ice cream was the lowest quality bland vanilla I've had in a long time, not to mention it was half melted when I got it. Her salmon was the best thing that hit our table (party of 7) the entire meal. That's not usually what you want to hear about a steak house, particularly one with a $500 tab.  Service was (to me) probably the worst part about the meal. It was a combined lack of effort that had to do with management, kitchen and service staff. The list below highlights some of the things... -Took 15 min to get my first coca-cola after the rest of our group already had drinks (we all ordered them at the same time). Then I received one refill over the 3 courses of my meal (2 hours) and went most of my meal and after-dinner conversation with an empty glass. Inexcusable even in cheap chain restaurants. -Side dishes came 5 min before the entrees. Not appetizers which were actually timely just not presented to the right people. Side dishes came 5 minutes before the entrees. Unreal. -Then the entree plates were presented to the wrong seats and items were mixed on wrong persons plates. (Scallops with the wrong steak.) -Desserts took 30 min after the table had been bussed from entrees and so forth for no apparent reason which usually means the server messed up somewhere. -then my sister-in-law had to remind our server that she never received hers and also did not receive her dessert until the entire rest of our party was finished with theirs.  This experience was the absolute last thing I expected from a reputable establishment like Flemmings. I'm extremely disappointed. Oh... And they don't sell/make sweet tea.

-BdX1Ymm9xXPvBIjtOXfnA.text: Fleming's was my date's choice and it was ok.  The steak was a little overcooked for me and the atmosphere was not that great.  We sat in the middle of the lobby and it was too much going on around me for me.  The bread was awesome.  The portions were a little on the petite side for the veggies but that is always the case at pretentious places like these.  But they get the steak perfect every single time and that is what we went for.

Hz5IFphl0GidFcqdjY_wHA.text: Very disappointed by the liquor selection. Woodford reserve should not be your top shelf bourbon.  I can get that for 7.00 at a dive bar.   And no, booker's is nothing to write home about either  This steak was the fifth or sixth best (not a bragging point at this price point) I have had in Charlotte The wife and I both agreed that a restaurant week steak at Ruth Chris killed Flemings at half the price.  A steak at 131 Main was also superior for far less. The wife argues that I can do better on our infrared grill with a good butcher cut.  Also disappointed in portion size. Steak was adequate, but the asparagus on the side was literally 4 or 5 small pieces  When my 120 lb wife complains about portion size...we have a problem.  We ordered appetizers, sides, desert and were not full.  Good service and decent atmosphere. The carrot cake was worth writing home about.  This was our highlight for the night  I left Ruth Chris wanting to come back.  I will also return to 131 main When wanting a steak. I left Flemings missing my $200 and promising to convince friends to go elsewhere.  The laundry list of positive reviews below refer mostly to happy hour.  We went for dinner. The reviewers that say this is the best steak in Charlotte have not been to Del Friscos or Ruth Chris or Sullivan's....or anywhere else a steak runs more than $20  ....now I have to take my wife somewhere else for a 'special dinner' as this one 'did notcount'

gR_zky-MqNpZgwlrrXs8Rg.text: This place is awesome! I came here for a client dinner. The food, the wine, the service... Impeccable! If there were 6 stars I would give Fleming's 6 stars! I recommend the Salmon. And check out their amazing app that allows you to figure out the appropriate wine pairings to match your order! I didn't touch the bread because I am on a diet, but it looked amazing!!!

Fp5lzSMV0XiJxSVbyc3sMA.text: We took family to Flemings and had an awesome experience.  The food was great and our server was awesome.  I can't wait to go back.

t07-SmSZ90awAMJKgk87Aw.text: Went here for restaurant week with my folks and it was really great. They were not too over the top like Ruth Chris! From the moment I sat down i had excellent service and great food. The caesar salad was great, my 3 crab cakes were very very good. As they were filled with lots of crab! (they should be that way) My family also ordered sides as additions to our meal. We got mashed potatoes and sauteed spinach. They were decent sized for 4 people to share off of. Lastly, for dessert I got raspberry sorbet which was great and refreshing. Overall, I really loved this place and would go there again. Next time I will try the steak and see if it tops Ruth Chris. ;)

H9uTqQELEc_w6-tNXOoztA.text: Absolutely horrible. We have been to Flemings before and frequent high end stake houses but this experience was by far the WORST! We planned a lovely family gathering and it started by half of our table not being able to order their desired drink because the bar was out of SEVERAL items, then when we ordered our meals the same thing happened, half our table wasn't able to order their desired item. I ordered my steak medium plus and it came out an hour later and ICE cold, I asked the waiter to see if they could hear it up, he brought it back 30 minutes later, I could tell it was the same steak because I saw the bite I had cut off it previously. I cut into the center to make sure it was cooked to my preference and it was raw inside and burnt to a crisp outside. I acknowledged it to the waiter and he was COMPLETELY rude and acted as though it was MY problem and I need to find the solution to fix it. I like going out to nice restaurants and spending more to do so but this experience was COMPLETELY inappropriate. We asked to speak to the manager several times and he never even came over. This is no way to treat customers. I highly urge you to spend your money elsewhere were you will be appreciated and respected.

YopcAmz8_gqdux9h6MwdNA.text: Let me say that the private party option here is fantastic.  Allison (private dining coordinator) is so great to work with, and really goes out of her way to accomodate our needs.  We've had our past two work Christmas parties here, and both were exceptional.  Great food, great service, and great atmosphere.  Relaxed, and not stuffy - which was just right for our group.  Wonderful experience, would love to come back and try out the regular dining side of things.  P.S.  Walnut Turtle Pie, just do it.

lV4ZFAjzMj3GwsVYKWwNqg.text: The place is fabulous for fine dining. Tony Anderson is a top notch server! Very happy with the service and food! Excellent place for celebrating Valentines Day! Thanks to the cooks and their team for absolutely great food!

UM6D6q05Ddf0T2s4Qrz0qQ.text: Arrived early for a 7 pm dinner reservation, the staff were very welcoming and graciously seated us early. Our waitress Virginia was knowledgeable and attentive without being intrusive. I had a perfectly cooked sirloin and my wife had the special filet with lobster tail which was delicious. We had been traveling since 3 am, spent the day at the track so a relaxing, fantastic meal was the best way to end a long day. The only thing that could have made this experience even better was if Tom (maitre d) would have sung for us.

LNiT3AjiPvKDej_7hF6PYg.text: My first trip to a Fleming's was in Charlotte during a business trip.  Ordered the Modern Caesar Salad and the Small Plate sliced Filet Mignon.  Not usually a huge fan of eating bread and butter... but I did that, too.  The food was excellent.  Perfect portion size to eat and not be completely overstuffed, which is so typical in most US restaurants.  Was a bit loud, but it was after the workday was over in uptown Charlotte, so it was to be expected.  Very pleasant staff as well.

b4bfY9l25QUZ2-LR403wdw.text: Great drink choices and quality food. Try and get there for happy hour (before 7pm) for good food and drink deals.

wx7T-TUCzgMQ910yb_wJHw.text: Delicious food - eloquent, classy atmosphere and impeccable service. It's pricey but I don't mind paying for good food. There are also happy hour specials if you sit at the bar before 7.

3DSYW7zOoJLrNMa0DmGnMw.text: We went to Flemings for our anniversary dinner.  We had  great time.  The waitres was very nice and the food was everything we hoped for.  I don't have one negative thing to say.  We will return.  Thanks for making our anniversary so special!!  #youmusttrythemacaroniandcheese

0_wcGhqqSd0Oeqc3ntSmVg.text: I know my rating on Service - 5 stars and Food - 3 Stars should average out to 4 stars, but the food is the main reason for going and I feel it carries more weight than the service.  The ambiance was nice, comfortable, and laid-back.  They had a nice "specialty drink" section and I enjoyed the wine by the glass selection, very thorough.  We had a waiter and waitress and they were on the top of their game, great service is always a plus.    The negative started with the appetizer, rubbery calamari.  When eating good calamari you should be able to bite through it, you should not have to chew it.  The sweet chili sauce and peppers were a nice touch and had good flavor, but the meat of the dish "calamari" was a poor showing.  If you're looking for a great calamari appetizer go to Dressler's, they know how to do it right.  Now on to the steaks.  My fiance ordered the PORCINI RUBBED FILET MIGNON, heavily seasoned with salt and pepper.  According to her, some bites were so salty it was hard to enjoy.  I know the bite she gave me was super salty and not enjoyable.  I ordered the Bone-In Blackened Ribeye with 3 oysters, nice crust and cooked to order, MR.  I enjoyed my steak, but have enjoyed better.  The experience was nothing to write home about, but it was worth giving all you yelpers a heads up.  CLT has lots of steakhouses; make a better choice than we did.

UdBW7525_A5UJlf2FyRKZA.text: Ok, after the last bad experience we had here the manager reached out an apologized for the experience  so i thought we would give it another try. So tonight before the basketball game we went to dinner and sat in the bar area. Guess who walks up to our table to be our waiter, you guessed right the same horrible bartender that we had the last time there. Well this time was a total different experience, he was cordial, fast and and gave us a great experience. The food was amazing and the service was great. I would recommend the bone in ribeye and the beef carpacio. I guess the other time we were there he was having a bad day which we all have.

UuHYvglP_nqTXm1VJI66sw.text: Had to pay it another visit, been so long and only one things change...Its gotten better. Food still amazing, service is awesome and your cup will never be empty UNLESS you say "no thanks I'm fine". If  you're looking for a fancy affordable spot look no further!

2XHonmTNmanLz4cB4LQ6cg.text: Fleming's is always a good choice for a celebratory dinner, a date, or just a really good happy hour.  The happy hour goes  until 7 and they have $6 apps and drinks.  It is definitely one of the better deals in town.  You can go next door to Z'Tejas for cheaper food or drinks but this is soooo much better.  The only downside is the bar seats maybe 30 people and is always packed during HH.    If you're sitting down for a full dinner hopefully you're there on a Sunday night.  They have a prime rib special that includes a salad, side, and dessert.  This is a very good deal if you can get it.  Otherwise the steaks are all done nicely and I can't recall having anything off the menu that I've disliked.

yQGaFMQ1QElEi3MaEGJwSQ.text: For the price of there steaks , it's highway robbery . I except to pay a pretty penny for steak but quality steak . The sides were good but for a great steak I do not recommend .

0tn6q29AxoF9HZOhLVXRkQ.text: Overdue review. My friend and I ate here a couple months ago on a Sunday and had a great experience. On Sundays they offer a prime rib special. It was delicious. Cooked perfectly. The sides were good and the wine that was recommended complimented our dinner. They weren't busy and I thought both the hostess and waiter were attentive. I'd recommend to friends and I'd eat here again.

eiYMlK1iDUSVwdAMisKraQ.text: My experience was awful the service was awful took the food forever to come when it did it was cold because it took took so long we got the dessert to go tried it at home the carrot cake was still frozen hate I celebrate my birthday their December 16 call to make a complaint to manger never received a call back I believe we got poor service because we was a table of 6 all black couples

Kf9BCM63FKYu2QtJ1xttuA.text: Visiting from out of town for the weekend, and after walking around the block we decided on Flemings for dinner.  The restaurant was more than half empty on Sunday night, but thought to try it. We were promptly greeted at the door and seated.  We thought maybe Flemings would be close to Ruth's but I have to admit it wasn't.  The service was so casual, it was pretty disappointing.  We really couldn't tell who our waiter really was as 2 of them kept working our table.  The food was good, and it gets 4 stars.  We enjoyed the crab cakes, each enjoyed our salads (house & wedge), and enjoyed great steaks cooked and flavored just right.  Service - 2 stars; as the service was very casual; waiters never introduced themselves;  the food runner failed to remove the appetizer plates when he brought the salads. Then finally one waiter engaged in conversation with us. But that just couldn't make up for the rather slack, casual service.  We enjoyed the food!  But we did not enjoy the service; and for the price it should have been better.

n7tHecTlcMHp0IyK33YZkg.text: This review is for the Happy Hour 5/6/7.  OMG, they have the BEST prime bacon burger for happy hour in the bar, it is such a deal for $6 and one of the best burgers I've had.  I've been here for dinner where you will get a great quality meal with a la carte sides, but a great reasonable option is to head here after work for Happy Hour.

photos.caption: Photo of Fleming's Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Amazing Prime Burger for Happy Hour - amazing deal, and oh so good

9w0eUix7heq0johSf0937A.text: Excellent wine menu. Attentive service! Had dinner with my wife and father enjoyed every bite. Creamed spinach was great. Steak was good. The bone in ribeye I normally get is the best cut with bearnaise and lobster with the rub is the best. House port to finish it off. Out of bounds  Go!

wm7EJkLMySvzB-64p9E0gw.text: Took a client there last night - excellent - great cocktails - ordered a really nice bottle of wine - and had a great meal - ordered the waygu NY strip - really delicious - as all prime steak houses - it's expensive but worth the trip - excellent service also

iKI3qxakbgvGHyvmTBOE-A.text: I love this place.  I like the atmosphere and feel of the whole restaurant.  Very good food, steaks, I always have the asparagus for a side which is exceptional.  Pricey drinks, wouldn't get again.  The food is worth giving it a try. Good service too.

HnIawVfjKydX5yehFyaevA.text: My wife and I had a terrible experience. I really don't want to waste my time writing this but I must write a few things - the server didn't know special offer was extended nor did he ever read/tell us the menu; Everything was inaudible; the asparagus was too cooked to the point that the tips were so dry it tasted like grass; only had medium cooked steak left which were tasteless; creme brulee top was too hard; the cheesecake tasted like goatmilk; the server made us wait forever before picking up our payment; and worst of all, never even seemed apologetic. We basically didn't finish or box half of the food. Oh and we were sat on a table with dead lightbulb which they acknowledged but did nothing. The servers behind us were talking and laughing too loud too. Terrible place.

pvnV6gGQQ6lJ8vQQ1QC_QQ.text: Go here for the wine list not the food. For the money the quality is too inconsistent. The manager brought us new lobster tails without our asking thankfully because they were so overlooked that he could not remove them from the shells. The new ones however were also over cooked. Meanwhile the steaks were room temp.

oF2T_2r-jESPg0gvTdzCHA.text: My boyfriend and I came here with my mom when she came to visit. It was a Sunday night so it was the one night they have Prime Rib. For wine we got the Trefethen which was delicious. We started off with the French onion soup and the burrata. They were both very good but if you are between the two I would say go for the burrata. It was so creamy and delicious. For my main course I ordered the filet mignon Oscar style with jumbo lump crab meat and my mom got the New York strip. My boyfriend was going to go for the prime rib dinner but the waiter convinced him to get a real steak so he got the prime dry aged New York strip and boy was he glad he did. We also got a side of the truffle mashed potatoes which were incredible. We left very full and happy. Definitely a great place and we can't wait to head back !

Photo of Fleming's Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Burrata appetizer. So delicious!

8KoYzXwvWeJsvAEwD7nczg.text: My party placed a reservation for late evening which was honored,  we were promptly seated.  Service seemed mostly OK for a bustling environment,  every table was full. Our drink order was promptly taken.    One of the early warning signs for me:  instant ice tea and no draft beer,  strange for this scale of operation.  Our orders were promptly taken,  and we waited.  And we waited... our orders were served an hour later.  Of course my party all ordered steaks and we all ordered them "medium".  This is where things became concerning.    We had two steaks in the party that would be considered well done,  one that perhaps was bordering on medium-well, and one that was... Raw.  Cutting into it we found a cold bloody center.  Remember we all ordered at the same time and the same  - medium.  Alerting the staff to this,  no one seemed surprised or apologetic.  They offered to put it back on the grill.  And it emerged twenty minutes later about right.  By this point we are on an hour and twenty for one of our party to be served.  Let's also look at the preparation of the steaks - they are all quite oily.  These have been prepared in the grand Waffle House style.... I unfortunately can say I have had better steaks at discount late night operations,  these just aren't good,  a disappointment considering the restaurants menu prices.  The sides,  a good variety of vegetables,  all are quite good and well prepared.  Overall,  this is a place you go for steak,  and bottom line I can get a better steak anywhere at 20-30% of the prices here.  If I want a premium steak I will make sure to go to one of the areas more predictable.  In summary -   -Service, not bad,  but nothing mind blowing either.  -Drinks,  suspect.  In the south we don't expect instant mango tea.  Beers not on draft.  Stick to wine,  they have a decent respectable wine list.  -Food,  sides of which we ordered half of the menu,  we're all respectable - quite good.  A stark contrast to the main course experience,  which was the opposite - very poor.  I saw other reviews that were either good or bad,  this one is hit or miss and we likely hit it when the wrong crew was in the kitchen.  Unacceptable at any restaurant let alone of this price level.

CYYVpDfDA_t0dIsRkFc3OA.text: This place looks like ever other steak house across the South and mid west. Black napkins brown leather low light. The wine list is just Ok but they offer a pour that is nearly a half bottle which is different. The sides come in full and half sizes which are still big. The stag is friendly and far from pushy. However at the end of the day it is a steak house so it all comes down to one thing the steaks. They have a classic cuts of mostly in aged beef and the classic steak house sides and fish options. I got the NY Strip which was priced in line with comparable spots. None of that really seems 5 star worthy yet, right?  Here why they deserve 5 stars; the steak was thick cut and probably a bit over the Oz stated raw when cut. Very little gristle and tail fat. I ordered mine 'rare' with an extra char and it was cooked absolutely perfectly. It was searing hot on the outside down to a cool raw centre. This is always how I order strip but this is one of the few times that the steak had great flavour and was actually cooked how rare is supposed to be. Despite the many unremarkable things about this place the steak and service are what a steak house are really all about and this laid back place served one of the best steaks I have ever had.

photos.caption: Photo of Fleming's Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States

5uq-nX53jujZtsHGtO5gZw.text: I took a couple of friends there last Sat.  We sat at the bar and it took 30 minutes for them to take our drink orders.  2 drinks out of the 3 never came... only one glass of wine.  We each got the dry aged ribeye and all were over-cooked.  Service was plain awful.  We were in casual clothes... when I'm there in a suit the service is much different but nonetheless it was not our favorite dining experience due to the service.

5x4H_nkDjM6WbmjagD0p-Q.text: Had an outstanding dinner with friends.  5 of us total.  Shrimp cocktail was fresh and tasty.  Had Wagyu BY strip w Kona coffee crust.  Green beans had Asian flare and were fabulous.  Other sides were excellent including asparagus and fries.  Dessert we had carrot cake which was moist and had pineapple in it.    I would not hesitate to go back.   Btw. It ain't cheap so if you are on a budget, go elsewhere.

nhhxre6GNBCgE6hkpEIWzA.text: First time for my hubby and I.  Beautiful restaurant and decor. We went on a Tuesday and it was quiet as I expected.  The food was good.  But...I wasn't wowed. With these prices, I expect to be wowed.  Customer service will keep me coming back to a restaurant time and time again.  There was nothing about the customer service that said 'we want you to choose us over any other steakhouse in town'.  Our server appeared uninterested in us, simply going through the motions.  It wasn't bad service...just not what I would expect if I'm going to spend the money to dine there.   We had lamb chops, prime rib, crab cakes, sweet chile calamari, the mushroom ravioli, truffle mashed potatoes and chocolate lava cake/carrot cake for dessert.  Everything was delicious, just not a wow.  I eat calamari as an appetizer everywhere I go, there's is definitely in the top 5.   There are just too many steakhouses in Charlotte for me to return unfortunately.  At least put a smile on your face when you come to our table.

7Gmb4nsGTTWWoM96Fshd3g.text: Would definitely come back because the food was delicious. The beef is the way to go and was plenty tender, cooked well, and great flavors. The sides were hot and filled with great complimentary flavors. The service was pretty good. For the price I expected wine pairings to be better in conjunction with not congregating in the dining room laughing and cleaning glasses. Overall it was good food and a good time out!

SVFpYckhBBs7ngYuwKoFwg.text: My husband and I went to the bar at Flemings to take advantage of the "Small Plates, Big Pours" offer and we thoroughly enjoyed our experience there.  We began our evening with the Baked Brie in Puff Pastry and it was delightful.  I selected the Filet over Risotto for my small plate and my husband had the Lobster Tempura...both were amazing! Our server/bartender was Shawn and he did an awesome job of taking care of our every need.  We will definitely be going back to Flemings as soon as possible. Thank you for a great evening out in uptown Charlotte!

e5KPF9wO2uAEI3piHjTRXg.text: Wonderful ! Went there for a lite dinner....prime burger. Perfectly cooked, with juices flowing even though I had requested well done. Certainly a great place to be in. Will be there every time I visit Charlotte.

WnDMThjP_X3Aww3n_vab6g.text: Great food. Attentive service. Elegant, cozy atmosphere. What else could one want? Highly recommend it.

LfKDg_lhk26WhfWoEWsCtw.text: Pleasant environment in this upscale steakhouse in Charlotte's new EpiCentre. The service was perfect (down to offering either light or dark linens, based on what I was wearing), the food was wonderful, and the portions were generous. I ordered from the Prix Fix menu, which yielded a huge salad, nicely sized entree, and large side. A plate of starter bites with cheese spreads also comes to each table. I didn't have room for the included dessert. Dinner, including a small bottle of water and a glass of wine was about $65.

o7HVBZuOhhURrf-1m9r5Pw.text: it rarely happens but there are times you do question your mothers ability to cook. only special places can arouse this thought, Flemings is one of them. I had the ribeye with mac and cheese green beans & mashed potatoes. The meat was tender, flavorful, and ultimately not sharable. Dare I say, more flavorful than Ruth Chris's ribeye. Sides are big enough to share and I had one the best bread pudding deserts there hands down, but they don't usually serve it. Not a heavy alcohol drinker but the wine selection appeared decent. For the financially challenged make this trip during lunch. For those looking for a great anniversary dinner not a bad way to show the one you love your not as cheap as you really are. For the daters, I have no advice , I'm only taking the wife here she has earned it (man that sounds so wrong but feels to right to say it). Service was great as it should be when you are spending this much legal tender.

KfeS9mmHV5v4LW9zU2AYLw.text: Stopped by Fleming's white staying in the Aloft hotel.  The staff is very friendly, and insists on calling you by name.  I started with a tomato and mozzarella salad, which is very hard to mess up, so it was very good.  Then I had the bone-in ribeye, with sides of fleming's potatoes (au gratin with cheddar and jalapenos) and sauteed spinach.  The steak quality is excellent, perfectly cooked and very tender.  The sides were also done very nicely.  For dessert I had the lemon gingersnap pie, which was also very good.  But the most impressive thing about Fleming's was the service.  Immediately after placing our orders, it seems like the waiter just walked back into the kitchen and grabbed our salads.  Once those plates were cleared, a runner was immediately at our table with our entrees and sides in hand.  Many fine dining restaurants will have you linger for hours over dinner, but this place has everything timed extremely well.  You definitely get what you pay for.

V2yATRns4Zvc6RVeJJ3pPg.text: Very impressed with Flemings...I especially liked their small plates options - which are larger than appetizers but much smaller than full plates.  This enabled us to get an app and a small plate for less than the price of a steak and have a bit more variety.  The bbq shrimp and crab louie were delicious as was the sliced filet mignon...

dPlSd7c2DMI_qXupq5KusQ.text: Walked in with no reservation and we were seated straight away.  It was a little before the normal dinner crowd which might explain the no waiting.    Everything is a la carte so for the main course I ordered a petite fillet and my wife ordered a seared Tuna mignon au poivre with tomato sherry vinaigrette, we also ordered the Flemings potatoes which turned out to be scalloped potatoes.   The steak and the potatoes were done perfectly, however the Tuna was not what we expected.  I would not call it seared as much as I would say it waved hello at a pan on its way to the plate.  The entire thing was really cold - not cool - cold and the vinaigrette was over powering.   We sent it back with the same comments and asked for the topping on the side the next time which really helped.  Even the second time around the tuna could have been warmer but it had very good taste.  Entire meal with a couple of drinks was $130ish.  With it all said and done I would go back with no hesitation.

GR3C30JHXHuINL1Xgvzz4A.text: A shout out to our waiter Jesse who was amazing!  We were out of town for the weekend for our anniversary and had a terrible meal so we needed to redeem it once we got back to Charlotte.  The food was also absolutely amazing. Filet was perfectly cooked and great flavor. My wife finished the whole 8 oz which she is never able to do.  They topped our meal off with chocolate truffles for our anniversary in an adorable gift box. They were absolutely amazing. My favorite was the white chocolate with a hint of lemon.  We have been to Fleming's before and certainly will be back.  Can you get a cheaper meal? Of course. But why take the risk on a less than amazing experience! Highly recommended!

_32RiDsp8F8iRR3UZqVuzg.text: I was disappointed in my entree is the only reason for the lack of stars. I ordered the Prime Strip (Med) and it was like rubber. My fries, Mac and cheese, and shrimp cocktail was great.

photos.caption: Photo of Fleming's Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. I ordered the Prime Strip (Med) and it was like rubber. My fries, Mac and cheese, and shrimp
Photo of Fleming's Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. I was disappointed in my entree is the only reason for the lack of stars.

RkAGdh6auE0YcUyWoYcXkQ.text: Decided to come here to celebrate my birthday with my honey. Since I was in the mood to eat a good steak. My dinner was delish!!! I had steak with mashed potato I love it and the blueberry drop were sooo good!!! My honey had a steak with a loaded potato. He was disappointed that they had no good steak sauce.  I was disappointed that when we ordered dessert they would have acknowledged my birthday and said something. They said nothing at allllll! Only because I mentioned it again when he bought our check the waiter decided to give me a box of chocolates WOW!! That was $300 well spent. NOT!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Fleming's Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. This how plain our dinner was along with everything else.

PfpbmkFCmEsZj6L1iiUePA.text: Yummy!  Personally, I love a steakhouse bar, they always stock the favorite high end bourbons, tequila and scotches poured over scotch rocks that I appreciate and you can enjoy a great ribeye in a more casual environment of the bar versus the white linen clothed tables and candlelight.   It was my first time in Flemings and I was initially impressed by the adoption of technology - menus for cocktails & wines were on tablets at the bar - score. Wine selection is great but personally I enjoyed my Blanton's bourbon over a scotch rock.   Ribeye - 11oz was ON POINT! They prepared it to perfection with a black & white peppercorn rub with a side of spicy green beans.   The appetizers were cool, the calamari was a large portion and had a sweet & sour flavoring but honestly it got boring quick.  The ribeye and green beans were my highlight of the trip - and the bartender who was very helpful.

n1g3SmbKgFNgWjpY86JVPA.text: My choice tonight was the double breasted chicken, flemings potatoes, and crab cakes. Yummy!   I do enjoy the atmosphere and for a Monday's hard day at work I deserve it. A nice hot meal prepared for me to indulge in. Although I'd prefer to be accompanied by a guest not all people like to splurge on food. My experience is worth the coins spent. Valet parking, impeccable service, delicious food, great lighting, and very intimate. Gives me time to reflect on things and appreciate the good in life.   I'll be back my friends

VrxFffP0deFmA14BD9OKhQ.text: Food is lack luster. We ordered a steak in a large group and were brought a short rib. We had to wait while everyone else was eating. When it finally came it looked delicious... Not. Not much taste at all.   The short rib that was brought was very tender but also lacked flavor. Maybe it was because it was during Queens Feast week. I'll come back and give it another try after the food "holiday."

VrKx0d6Ac8uStsNdoegs5g.text: My husband and I have visited this location 3 times in the past several years and the 3rd time will definitely be our last. I will preface this review by saying that our 1st  time here, we ate in the main dining room and had a great experience so, my gripe is really about the bar (which we visited the last 2 times). We stopped in the bar for a bite before one of the pre-season Panthers game and felt like we were not wanted. The staff acted irritated that we were there and were not attentive at all, but we sucked it up. When we hesitantly walked in few weeks ago, we were literally the first ones to sit at the bar because they had just opened. I think we were there for about 5 min before we got up and left. Absolutely no acknowledgement was made by the 2 bartenders....well, actually they did look at us as they were greeting their friends who sat down after. The 2nd experience left such a bad taste in our mouths that we didn't have the patience for a 3rd. We walked down to Chima and were greeted by a pretty busy bartender before we even sat down. My husband currently works in the restaurant industry and I worked as a server/hostess for 8 years so, we get it. This type of service two times in a row was just plain unacceptable and we will not be back.

sSQEkJhe5MRrafD_LR6E8A.text: You can't find better bartenders.  Friendly, and know their craft well.  The happy hour is a bargain.  Delicious food items, even if you never reach the steaks. The manager Robert is warm and welcoming.  You will feel right at home.

Gd6sgEaF4QJRK_oyCnPwVQ.text: We had a very good experience on this trip. We had a large group and the staff handled it well. I struggled with what rating to give. I do not give out five stars lightly, but I really struggled with a reason to lower it at all.  The decor is like you have come to expect from Fleming's across the country. It is clean, and cool. The staff was attentive and friendly through out the evening. Our server was knowledgable and provided helpful advice on food and drinks.  We started with some wine for the table. Our server made a solid recommendation that was well received by the group. I wish I remembered the name of the wine.  We started with a few appetizers. I tried the Pan-Crisped Pork Belly. The pork belly comes with creamy goat cheese grits and sweet onion chutney. Those three components combined for some good flavor.  For my meal I ordered the Main Filet Mignon medium rare. It came out as ordered. The meat was juicy and packed solid flavor. We had several sides for the table as well. As always I ate a lot of Fleming's Potatoes. They are fantastic. I also ate some of the sauteed corn. That was a pleasant surprise. The flavors and textures were very good. The last side I tried was the Chipotle Cheddar Mac & Cheese. It was creamy and tasty. I was far too stuffed to order any dessert.

A8U-oHALApqRvJttBpungg.text: The staff were friendly and helpful. I would give them a higher rating, but the food was just ok nothing special. I have a low tolerance for salt so the servers said they would requested none on my salmon entree for me. I am disappointed to say though the salmon was low salt the mushrooms it was laying on unbearably salty so much so that I could not eat them and I love mushrooms. Although the server looked out for us when we ordered and answered questions she never did check back in to see how our food was. I have learned I am just not a steakhouse person. My husband's hanger steak was pretty amazing though and for a "small plate" it might have been the same size as my entree.

photos.caption: Photo of Fleming's Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bread basket two different butter spreads, sourdough bread, very flaky crust.
Photo of Fleming's Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Hanger steak small plate.
Photo of Fleming's Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Salmon entree on mushrooms. Mushrooms super salty.

q7BFyogiBG8S2ptWqKhgsg.text: I'm 100% sure I and my entire party got food poisoning from this restaurant. Service was good  But I had 5 people throwing up and other details I may not mention all over my house only a few hours after we ate there

6ocYpOAh-3tL58_7uz-0AA.text: Delicious filet mignon and great wine selection. Really appreciated our waiter's desire to talk to us, offer suggestions, and make conversation. Loved my dinner!!

Sa5ybQZkBuDGQOfyh4_yIQ.text: We were introduced by our host to two waiters who evidently forgot their GPS at home, because they couldn't find their way back to our table.  After being there for over 1.5 hours, we finally received our food (and only after reminding the staff that we weren't sitting there because we love their carpet and think they just have the darnest chairs in the world).  We were not asked if we wanted a wine refill until the 1.5 hour mark when we also asked them for the whereabouts of our food.  We received our food shortly thereafter, despite putting in our orders within 15 minutes of being seated.  There was no apology or explanation for why our food took so long, despite the tables around us being empty.  Our waters were only refilled once.  If not for the amazing company I was with, I would have left at the 1 hour mark.  Food wise.. I was not particularly hungry so I ordered a salad and a side dish (lobster tempura) as my main course.  I fully regret asking them to hold on bringing out the salad until everyone received their main dish.  My lobster tempura was really meh.  Like, really meh.  It reminded me of state fair food, where you find oreos/junk thrown into a batter of disgusting oil.  The portion for the lobster tails definitely looked big, but the oily crust was 75% of the plate.  Not worth the $27 price tag.  I will say that the portion for the steak looked bigger than advertised -- definitely a plus, but not enough to make up for the non-existent service.

Njox3_V1OYebRxICIoCDnQ.text: Had an awesome time at flemings. Service was fantastic, he was very knowledgeable about the wine list and the steak was cooked to perfection for medium rare. Will be again in the future

sYfmsZ28Q-cnIa4ERp4NSw.text: Second time dining here. First time I ordered the lobster and king crab meal, second time the tenderloin carpaccio and scallop.  I am a lot more satisfied with my second dining experiences! Other than a little bit too much pepper on the scallop, everything is great! And the tenderloin carpaccio oh so fresh! Love that when I can discover great food in a new place

photos.caption: Photo of Fleming's Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tenderloin carpaccio
Photo of Fleming's Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Scallops

vlCw9SoZ0H0yCgOjc1p2ew.text: You'll see that I am mostly a Capital Grill guy, but last night was Sweeties birthday and she hasn't stopped talking about the Lobster Tempura at Flemings for over a year so, as always I must sacrifice because that's the kind of guy I am.  Well, I am happy to say that last nights experience was nothing short of spectacular.  Called to make reservations and informed them of said birthday.  While we were there no less than 5 employees besides our waiter stopped by to wish her a happy birthday.  Special right?  We were greeted by our server Jim.  He was great and part of the reason I like these "Prime Steakhouses".  He was a presenter if you know what I mean.  His descriptions of the dishes, and option were wonderful.  This guy knew more about dry vs. wet aging of meat than most and was a True salesman.  His service was wonderful throughout the evening, and exemplified what a True "professional" server should be.  Onto the meal.  Chilled seafood tower to start.  Usually I won't opt for the tower since it's somewhat intimidating.  But tonight I was out to impress....pull out all the stops.  They bring the tower which was chock full of fresh, chilled goodness.  Lobster, Stone Crab Claws, King Crab Claws and the largest, freshest most delicious shrimp ever.  WOW.  The only think missing was oysters, but the shrimp made up for it.  I had the Prime Bone in Ribeye.  This steak was delicately grilled at a super high temperature and served at the perfect medium rare as requested.  It was well seasoned and slightly charred on the outside.  It cut like butter and was just awesome.  Sweetie had the Ahi Tuna small plate which she said was wonderful.  Cream Spinach, ala carte on the side was done nicely and wasn't so rich that I felt bad eating it.    Finishing off the meal was a complimentary dessert sent over by their chef for the birthday (Classy touch) and, as recommended by Jim who said he wasn't afraid to tell his Mother that Flemings Carrot Cake was better than hers, a nice serving of Carrot Cake.  They put pineapple and golden raisins in their carrot cake which is a nice touch.  It was decadent.  Great night, great experience.  Flemings outdid themselves last night and it was appreciated.

PEPb1BCJuQWzi5wIIY-UDg.text: The best place I've eaten in Charlotte!!!!! Amazing!!!  great service excellent food !!!!

scEPxpAUH5nRdUFlW3nj6Q.text: This was our first time at Fleming's, and we loved everything about it! My husband and I were there to celebrate our 25th Anniversary; they made it very special for us. The chilled seafood tower for two appetizer was so good. For our main course, we both had the filet mignon, which was cooked perfectly and the best steak ever. My husband said he's never eaten a steak that he was able to cut with a fork! Everything was absolutely delicious. Everyone who worked there was so nice and the service was outstanding. There is another high-end steakhouse restaurant in Charlotte that has now been replaced by Fleming's as our favorite. We will definitely be back in May to celebrate our son's college graduation, and looking forward to it! Thanks for a wonderful meal, Fleming's!

9d7lIrzS2RevfqYUQBw7fA.text: Great waitstaff but just average, high-end food. The New Zealand lobster tail was tough. Morton's and The Capital Grille have them beat.

h5IDDRY04XipbUmnc4PaRA.text: Amazing experience, Jim was the best waiter I have ever had the pleasure of having. Great service, recommend waiter Jim!

Lpx-Frh5L8AwAXgs_ah-rA.text: Went here for my husbands birthday and it was really good. Tom the managing partner was incredibly accommodating. Great wine selection and my husband said the dry aged rib eye with truffle  Poached lobster was amazing!

UCRwJs4SCfIb8gdeacudbg.text: The food was very good,  opposed to service... probably won't go back. If you are paying about $100 per meal, you would expect a nice and helpful service. I had a much better service in Morton's or even in McCormick's. Sadly,  at the end I made a mistake and mis-down-calculated the tip... anyway Fleming's is off the list forever while many other nice places are out there. The ambiance of the restaurant is good, though.

ytUbLrOYPSXQwma0A9Oiew.text: Incredible ambiance, fantastic steak.  Ordered medium rare and  got the perfect medium rare filet.  Salad was perfect with their own dressing.  The Fleming potatoes were out of this world, had jalapenos in them.  A re invention of Augratin.  Great dining experience, will definitely go to this location next time I am in Charlotte.

VgodlnWIHdKVxsfbbgahcg.text: Our first trip here on the recommendation of friends for her birthday.. They had been once before and loved it.. We had an early reservation (5:30).. The expectations were unfortunately overhyped.. My wife and I ordered the  filet, poached lobster, Diablo shrimp, Flemings salad, loaded potato, sprouts, Turtle pie, and started with calamari. The calamari was good - the loaded potato was the highlight of the meal.  They have a black Hawaiian sea salt that is great.  Shame we are talking about salt for a prime steakhouse.  The steak was ok - but not $60 ok.. had to be sent back as it was rare, as in purple color. Came back out fine but the overall taste was not as good as what I fix at home - and nowhere near Ruth Cris or Morton's..  The lobster was a little rubbery but not overly done. The diablo shrimp was a good addition - but 3 medium sized shrimp versus the "colossal" they claimed was disappointing.   They asked at check in who the Bday was going to be for and we advised. Not once was that ever acknowledged at the table.  Our friends were embarrassed at the meal after hyping this up for a month. I always hate that and have been head over heels for a place, only to be bad the time we take out friends.  Also - pass on the turtle pie. We took home to eat and ended up throwing in the trash. Just wasn't good. Our friends got the lava cake - that was solid!  Overall, the food is not bad.. it just wasn't good. And when you drop $500 for a table of 4... the food should be spectacular. Perhaps going during the busy time would make the food better - but based on last night, we won't be back. Too many better options out there to spend your money on..

S8sw_cRO8vLcqxF5ghGkmQ.text: We enjoyed every thing we ate, drank and the atmosphere - also the people who worked there were all very pleasant. I especially loved the salads.

0IjKFf0YVj0Shz_r0ElxhQ.text: Excellent filet mignon- Best in Charlotte! Cooked to perfection- our waiter, Jim Brand, knew everything you'd ever want to know about beef- so we could make the best choice based on what we preferred. Creamed spinach was delicious, as was the Flemings salad. Alaskan King Crab legs was a generous portion & perfect!!!!! Thank you for a great evening!

5eLS9hxRtZqJQU-RNgqIDw.text: My friend and I went to Flemming's during a night out. My favorite part was the outstanding wine list by the glass. We had the seafood sampler, two bone-in ribeyes, and creamed spinach. The food was great as expected. The service was outstanding and with a reservation we were seated immediately on a very busy Saturday night. The expectations were pretty high going into this restaurant and I was pleasantly surprised.

xmc4c6Jn1N7jPMERK8Zp9w.text: Both my friend and I had ever been to other Fleming's location, but first time in Charlotte's.   We both chose their prix fix special and we were really disappointed. Both steaks were NOT cooked right (1 medium rare another medium) both were very very very dry. Desserts was not impressive either.   The server was not paying attention, we tried many times to find him, at the end, had to ask for other server to look for him, he also made mistake on the charge...   Dirty napkin on the floor, no staff seem cared to  pick it up... I will never visit this Fleming's again.

bTSpM-YWyptMBQyZvxWzXA.text: We went here just for after dinner drinks and desert. Even though we didn't have dinner we still would recommend Flemmings. Facili thy is well appointed, upscale and inviting. It was a bit noise but noyhing that would deter my coming back. The patrons seemed to be professional and we'll dressed. The dessert we had was the cheese cake and it was delicious. We will try to make it back here for dinner and I will edit my review.

9XcRrhdh2hbdFtW056FdzA.text: We've been here several times and I love it more each time. Their service and attention to detail is second to none. Each time we go we feel like VIPs and have a great experience.  Last night I ordered a filet cooked medium rare and it was perfectly cooked and seasoned.  My fiance and I are having out parents in town to celebrate our wedding this month from Chicago, Florida, and Colorado, and I can't wait to bring them here.  I wish there were more establishments like this one!

JmbJgowMX4LmAswcBgyFjQ.text: Ordered a steak. Pretty good but not impressive. For the price I would have expected a little better. Don't get me wrong, but a $50 steak should be awesome. Not mediocre.  I ordered asparagus as side dish, they were good. Not excellent. I sat at the bar, good and friendly quick service. But what's with the TV guys. It's a restaurant. Not a sports bar. On a scale from 1-10 I'd give it an 8. Ish.

3n9fRUIXz9cj4O_44ZM6gQ.text: I went to an event catered by Fleming's so I'm not sure how it compares to the food at the restaurant.    1) The positives - Cheesy potato goodness, a willingness for the chef to find a perfectly rare steak for me to devour,crisp green asparagus, and the cost ...zilch, yup free!   2) The only teeny-tiny negative: they seasoned their steak with Montreal steak seasoning. If this is a high-end steak place I would think they could come up with their own blend....it tasted a lot like a steak I could make at home and I can spot that stuff anywhere. Don't get me wrong it wasn't bad, but it's not something I'd expect at a fine dining establishment...a good steak doesn't need a ton of embellishment in my opinion.    If they don't use that seasoning in the restaurant I will definitely go back...but if they do I'd probably just opt for grilling out myself.

PYW3JWgb4y2vJuZAAbG4zA.text: I'm not a Fleming's newbie.   I've visited their La Jolla, Woodland Hills, and Walnut Creek locations (all in California) numerous times and have always had a wonderful experience.   When I saw that there was a Fleming's right across from my hotel, I made sure to dine here at the first opportunity.  Being by myself, I opted to sit at the bar and started off with a Fleming's Classic Martini.   I sipped merrily on my cocktail while perusing their menu and honed in pretty quickly on the lamb chops and their Chipotle Mac & Cheese.  The food arrived actually right as I took my last sip of martini.   Having ordered a beautiful meal, I figured I'd accompany it with a nice glass of red wine and I ordered a glass of Hall Cabernet at 18 dollars  (I know, ouch!)   Here's where they lost that 5th star:  they brought me a carafe and poured me the glass of red wine but I never actually got to see the bottle of Hall.    Now that's not saying that they totally gave me some cheap red wine instead of what I ordered.   While my palate isn't so sophisticated I certainly am able to tell the difference between swill and more elegant vintages.   Nevertheless, if I'm going to venture out and blow almost 20 bucks for a *glass* of wine, show me the bottle, will ya?  The meal was lovely and the wine paired well with the lamb and Mac & Cheese.   I stuffed my face, royally and had a wonderful meal.   Most certainly I would come back in a heartbeat.    I actually had to laugh at some point when I looked down the bar and realized I was the only person there drinking wine.   Everybody had a glass of bourbon, or some martini or other, and that includes the few people that, like me, had opted to dine at the bar.     What's the dead giveaway that there's a Northern California in your restaurant, I chuckled to myself?   Look for the guy who's sitting at the bar, eating lamb chops and drinking a glass of red wine.    Classic!

czIx2V4zHZj8oOVyle-A7w.text: Good service and good food! Jesse did a great job of taking care of us. I will be back.

4iCdrw6shea9HVm5xf8hrg.text: We ate here earlier today. The food and service were outstanding. The attention to detail in this restaurant is way above par.   I had the Sea bass which was perfect. My wife had the crab cakes and thoroughly enjoyed them.   We will be returning to Flemings in the future.

4xAiht8n7HfTjzDKRFO--w.text: BEST SERVER EVER!!!! We had Jesse F. as our server and he really added to the meal. We were in town for a bowl game and he stayed conscientious of both our time and the food for us. Cannot say enough about him...if you go here ask to be seated in his section as he really knows both the food and the area. He gave us great area recommendations and gave us a new tip of "splitting salads" when you order a few appetizers to go with your meal. It made so much sense when we did it and I can't thank him enough for keeping us from being too full before our steaks came out.   We started with the jumbo shrimp and beef carpaccio. Shrimp were a little longer and skinnier than what we are used to as Morton's regulars. All in all, they were pretty good though. The carpaccio was really good. Very flavorful and had a decent amount of capers. The sauce and bread on it was unique but added so much to the flavor. We split a wedge salad and that was good enough to end on.   However, we soldiered on and had a strip steak and a bone-in filet. The steaks were freakin' amazing. The strip was 14-16 oz. and full of flavor. I'd never had a bone-in filet before but this was a great steak. Both steaks were prepared perfectly to our specifications and the chef even came out to make sure the meal was going well. The sides of garlic mashed potatoes and asparagus were prefect and delicious.   We could not have asked for a better evening or meal and I really applaud Flemings on their strong service and high quality of food. We expected the meal to be expensive and it was but for a bottle of great wine and 2 steaks, 2 apps, 2 sides and a salad we weren't surprised by the total. If you aren't ready for the bank account commitment go to Texas Roadhouse. (Which has solid steaks too for the price...but you'll miss out on so much and Jesse!)

jQWk3EoTqBAB5wSqbmiZoA.text: Still great from last review.  Great service on eve before Valentine's Day and they were offering a special of lobster tail and fillet or salmon and fillet.  Unfortunately, my lobster was very dry and tough and no butter for dipping.   My husband's salmon was excellent.  Both of our fillets were great. It was disappointing that they had a social for desert was offered but when ordered we were told they didn't have all the ingredients to make it.  We did have a great booth for which we had asked for and service was great.  Just some slight disappointments.

xEO_wIUJ4wGTzWlSKsut2g.text: Fleming's is always good, isn't it?  You'll pay for the food and service, but it isn't easily bettered. Wait staff is very professional, very friendly. Food is very good, as always.

hQ2pHtBNClOOi6sbJ0mi4Q.text: Ok, so my husband and I messed up. We bought tickets to see Jersey Boys for the Saturday night during the CIAA Tournament. We left our house really early and crawled up 7th, literally crawled, to the point where I had to call and inform the restaurant that we were going to be late for our reservation.  The man who answered the phone was very understanding and accommodating. We finally secured a parking spot and weaved our way in and out of the massive crowd, forward and finally into Flemings. There were some people waiting in the lobby area and I immediately feared we would be joining them since we were approx 10 mins late for our reservation. We checked in with a female hostess and the man, turned to us with a big smile and said, "you weren't even that late," making us feel very welcome.   We were taken to our seats right away. We were initially seated at a table but asked to be moved to a booth since we were celebrating our anniversary. The super friendly hostess did so with no complaint and then asked how long we had been together (7 years!).   Shortly after being seated our waiter, Jesse, came over and asked if we were going to the show and verified what time it started to make sure that we would be finished with enough time to fight the crowds on the street to get to the show. He made some suggestions for appetizers and whatnot and then we placed our order. The ONLY way this meal fell short is because the appetizer arrived before our drinks. Normally this would not be acceptable but the bar was so busy and it wasn't as though the employees were standing around not working. Since it was only about a minute difference I decided to let it go and just enjoy the evening.   We started with the BBQ shrimp which were very tasty. The husband really enjoyed them as did I. I ordered the filet cobb salad with what they called a tarragon ranch, that just tasted like a regular ranch to me but it was still good. My only issue with this meal was that it seemed for the $27 price tag there should have been a bit more meat. In the end, however, it proved to be the right amount of food and I left feeling full but not overly stuffed.  The husband order the lite filet which came with a side of the Fleming's potatoes and a side of mac n cheese. He allowed me bites of each side and I have to say they were pretty delicious.   Jesse (the waiter) was really good with helping with a wine selection (a delicious Malbec at a totally reasonable price!) and seriously provided the best service we have had in a very long time. He was there when you needed him but not overbearing and just had a great personality. I found the service to be so top-notch that I even stopped the manager to compliment him, which is not something I normally do.   After the meal was completed and we went to pay we decided to sign up for their e-mail program and when he took the form to the hostess she informed it that it was our 7th anniversary and he brought us a small box of 4 truffle chocolates which was the perfect touch to end a perfect dinner on what originally looked like it was going to be a not so perfect night.   We will def be going back and asking for Jesse to be our server again!

hEpDAylphMxrBmjUEd09vQ.text: I had dinner at Fleming's after work last night. I'm a regular there so this review will probably lean more towards the bigger picture than just one visit. I remember eating at a Fleming's in Nashville when I was in college. It was the first and only time I'd been to one before they opened in Charlotte and I remembered it being the best steakhouse meal I'd ever had. When I heard they were opening one here, I was stoked. Needless to say we started going there not long after they first opened (I think it was 2008 but don't hold me to that) and have been going regularly ever since. I've done the steakhouse circuit - Ruth's Chris, Capital Grille, Sullivan's, Morton's - but Fleming's to me is just nicer than all of them. It's not as stuffy as Ruth's Chris or Morton's and the food is better. It's classier than Sullivan's, and, well, I just never really liked Capital Grille at all. Maybe I'm picky.  The ambiance at Fleming's is lovely. It's an easy place to relax. There have been times I didn't even realize the restaurant had gotten busy because I was happily nestled in my own booth, absorbed in the food and conversation. The lighting is dim, but not so dim you can't read the menu. Dark, rich wood adorns the booths and walls, giving the restaurant a sort of classic look. And the service? What can I say about the service? Our usual server is Azer and he is always so welcoming and seems genuinely happy to see us. He's attentive and spot-on with everything and every experience is relaxed and enjoyable. Tom and Jared, two of the managers, are equally welcoming and friendly, always stopping by to say hello and catch up. They make eating at Fleming's feel like visiting friends instead of just being an anonymous restaurant patron, which always makes me want to go back.  I've made my way around the menu from the delicious filets to the sea bass that is frequently a special, to the small plates (the short ribs are my favorite on that list) to the king crab legs. You really just can't go wrong with this menu. Last night I had the petite filet with the mushroom risotto and it was delightful. Sometimes I treat myself to the chocolate lava cake for dessert, which is one of the best things I've ever tasted. The combination of gooey chocolate cake and the liquidy hot fudge with vanilla ice cream is just to die for.  Their after-work happy hour bar menu is great, too. It's more casual, the star of which is a cheeseburger and fries. I've sat at the bar and had the burger on several occasions and it was delicious. Very juicy and slightly peppery for a little extra flavor. It's a fun bar atmosphere, too, if you're looking for a  place to chill after a long work day. Sometimes it's a nice, informal way to enjoy my favorite restaurant without doing the full dining room experience.   All in all, Fleming's is just a fantastic restaurant with great food, spot-on service and an enjoyable atmosphere. They've created such an enjoyable experience that I can only keep going back time and time again.

sBf56w50dUYzB55VrEIlLw.text: First, it's important to understand that this 2/5 rating is reflective of a fine dining establishment. It's still much, much better than the traditional steakhouses; but, compared to Ruth's Chris, Del Frisco's, Morton's, etc., this restaurant just doesn't stack up.   Perhaps it's because they were running their Queen's Feast promotion, but the cuts of filet were surprisingly thin and a touch overdone across the entire table (5 people). Honestly, it was shocking.  Everyone enjoyed the tie starter; the salads and lobster bisque were delicious. But, while tasting great, the lobster bisque lacked any lobster.  Finally, I had the carrot cake for dessert, which wasn't served for 10 minutes after our table was cleared. There's a difference between moist cakes and wet cakes, and this cake was wet, small, and doused in caramel.  With all the other places to go in Charlotte, I'd recommend skipping this and going somewhere else.

arXaV7Wq3DD5vA-50qJVDg.text: Ehhhh let me tell you why I was underwhelmed with Fleming's. I used to go to the Crabtree location (in Raleigh) for the 4-5-6 and 8-9-10 happy hours all the time, and had an absolute ball. So I decided to meet a girlfriend at this location for HH. Unfortunately, this location doesn't have nearly as good a selection of happy hour cocktails. There weren't any cocktail specials at all here!! I ordered the calamari- which was just okay- and the burger (which never disappoints). I can't say I'd be back because I only came for HH and without drink specials, the hour isn't all that happy to me lol. I know it's North Carolina and the laws are weird around HH drink specials, but they could work around that if they wanted to. Oh well. I'll just keep hunting for a perfect HH spot. Fleming's won't be it.

d06e7fqGTm1C0gMFt7d2ag.text: Love this place!  The food is fresh and fantastic. The steak melts in your mouth & the Fleming's potatoes are outrageous.  The strawberry basil martini was no longer listed on menu but excellent server was able to get the bartenders make me one. Reason for 3 stars - I should have stuck to my regular ribeye, filet, or chicken but instead I switched to a tomahawk special. I was not happy with the the tomahawk. It was more pink then I usually eat my steak & personally just did not like the flavor. My daughter did not eat the tomahawk either but definitely enjoyed the potatoes! I know next time to stick with what I usually get.

Q1PoifTE7oV0dL6JXN2ZRg.text: Don't waste your time coming here on a weekend. The people at the epicenter are complete trash and don't know how to drive. Parking is non existent and there is no valet for flemmings. The epicenter valet was unattended and all parking was full. Save your time and hassle and go to capital grille where they actually have their crap together

ZLDDC7gV2oiM--aRSrG-Ew.text: Great experience at Fleming's. Service was great, recommendations on food and wine, and nice atmosphere. Thank you Maurizio for taking care of us last night. We enjoyed the tomahawk steak, lobster Mac and cheese, Brussels sprouts and amazing desserts.

ujHqAqoTUSRqNHulcrvaMA.text: Food was ok service was good made mistakes with the menu. Weekly menus were given instead. Customer service could be more attentive and the lobster bisque soup was very oily. We spent $280 for a couple; we've had a better dinner at other restaurants. Just Disappointed!

B-Y9SMozyX3_7oc1WZpMFg.text: We were in Charlotte for Thanksgiving. Decided to eat at Flemings. They had a Thanksgiving special. The food was delicious. Probably the best carrot cake I have ever had.  Great waitstaff. Beautiful Decour.

SjE2ZTJxVL5jL2bZuoc4XA.text: Truly enjoyed our experience. It was our wedding anniversary and the staff stepped it up big time. Thanks to them. Beth was a solid, attentive server that we can highly recommend. I had a really swell ribeye prepared perfectly and loved the grilled Brussels Sprouts. Kudos all the way around. Great night.

FtD9f6GrOyYe7RPmMo9Ynw.text: I love places that let me schedule my reservation through OpenTable. Makes life that much easier. When we arrived we had valet parking out front which was seamless and when we got in, we were seated immediately. Service all around was great.   The food was good. My wife had the steak, but she thought it could have been cooked better when it comes to cooking it medium well. I some fish and shrimp, that was ok. It was good enough to eat but the fish didn't have enough flavor.

photos.caption: Photo of Fleming's Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Fleming's Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States

ZjSLuCQMLbCJ9BNRLApDLw.text: SweetPam and I chose here for a nice Date Night dinner before a show.  We had never been here before, but I must say WE WILL BE BACK!  The food was over the top delicious, and the staff was very attentive.  Color me impressed.

t5SPIX68EFbu6al8y7h-GQ.text: Now I know, Flemings is a chain and I'm not fond of chains. But, I also do a ton of work entertainment and honestly they cook a perfect steak and the service is impeccable without being formal or stiff.  In the past I have even boycotted my local Flemings because of an assistant manager and his totally crappy attitude to the staff and customers. (He's no longer there)  I have been back twice recently and I'm back into the high on Flemings groove.  Admittedly they still have an over priced wine list so you have to know your wines to find the hidden gems.  The ambiance is one that envelops you (in every Flemings I have visited) if it hot out its cool and relaxing, if it's cold outside it's warm and comfy. Who could ask for more?  The menu is always great from starters through desert and the steaks are perfect!

VpOk6_TQcl72Ati5SBb-Tg.text: Parking is the worst part of going here. They DO have valet but I'm not a fan of any valet service. Service was spot on and accurate. Had the sea bass special which was over risotto and topped with scallops and shrimp. Couldn't have been more tasty and perfectly cooked and seasoned. Wife had the steak (filet) which I did try and it also was delicious. Oh, we also had the housemade burrate and that was very good as well. No question it's pricey, I think the bill was $300+ after tip for two people, but worth it to us for a great meal experience.

LQDI5D0h_5hGDBSSO0RjTA.text: I had my third best restaurant experience/ 2nd best steak dinner at this restaurant. Best steak I've had in Charlotte. Not only the steak was excellent and perfectly cooked, the sides really set it out from other restaurants. Service was good every time we've been here. Favorite steak in Charlotte!

LStVkYMxMv8snqDNfkCeug.text: Ultimate seduction. Prepare to have a Foodgasm explode in your mouth if your order the filet or dry aged ribeye. Do yourself a big favor, don't order chicken or seafood, go for the beef. This is where it's at. Best beef in the CLT. I've had Morton's, Ruth Chris, Sullivan's and Capital Grille but this place has the best steaks. If you want fu-fu service, this isn't the best  place for you but if you want good service and beef that's better than sex, come here. Tip: the blueberry lemon drops are 1/2 price every night. It's a steal.

photos.caption: Photo of Fleming's Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mai Tai...it&#39;s good but not great. Stick with the blueberry lemondrop
Photo of Fleming's Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mac n cheese to die for.
Photo of Fleming's Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Spinach Salad with chèvre fritter

sPjkgAiINgpc5Y5PvIsQjQ.text: I've only been here once and was in a rush because I had to catch a flight. My waiter was very accommodating. He took my order right away (but not without first listing out some helpful recommendations) and was able to get my food out in 12 minutes!    I got the slow cooked salmon and it was absolutely delicious! Very tender and flavorful. It's definitely a smaller portion than the steak alternatives because there are no sides though. I'm not sure if it's really worth the $48 I spent (+tips).   However, my experience was phenomenal. The super attentive wait staff definitely makes me want to visit again.

photos.caption: Photo of Fleming's Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Slow cooked salmon

NHXn8P4FTdQuw-Vii7Yz4g.text: We were in town for Marine Week and decided to give Fleming's a try. We were disappointed. Their highly touted dry aged ribeye steak was way over salty and not cooked to order. The filets were not cooked to order. The meal took 2.5 hours. We had to wait 20-30 minutes for dessert that was ordered with the meal and another 20-30 minutes for our bill because the computer was not set up to break down a party of 11. However the lobster was delicious. No plans to return. We've had much better dining experiences in places that cost much less.

K6PRg1hby-RcEPcZU8Eudw.text: The Flemings in woodland hills California and downtown LA are the ones we frequent and have even held business events at. Tonight we stopped in Charlotte and was not as impressed.   The calamari was delicious as always as well as the burrata salad. My grilled salmon was overcooked as I asked for it rare and it was over done. They re cooked it perfectly. The petite filet was delicious and perfectly flavored. The bone in rib eye was just ok as the flavor was good but a little tough. No one even asked why we barely touched it.  We ordered the lava cake early when we got our soup and after they cleared our final meal's it still took 40 minutes for the waiter to bring it. When we asked about it the waiter said they are plating it. We literally sat unattended or checked on for 30 minutes and we stood to get a bus boy to find our waiter. Our waiter Jesse  wasn't around much and certainly had no concern for our comments.   My husband asked for a mgr and waited for a few minutes but decided to just Yelp it as no one came out and our meal took over 2 1/2 hours.

D7jAKaUoE-FKxtC5Ac-UAQ.text: When your offering has to compete with the most expensive restaurants in Charlotte, you have to do things to make yourselves stand out.  Wow customers with service, add some novel twist to your offering to make it special, provide incentives or some kind of special insider deal to make people feel like they're unique.... something.  We've eaten at Flemings a few times and every time I had been there, except for the most recent visit, I concluded pretty much the same thing.  The service is exceptional.  Every time.  The food is good.  Exceptional?  no... but you're going to get good food.  And the atmosphere was a great place to let loose and feel a bit swanky and modern at the same time.  This time all of it came crumbling down however.  The service was average, the food remained good, but the atmosphere was drab and appeared to be struggling a bit for a Friday evening.    Our waiter just generally seemed uninterested.  Yes, we had the scoop from an online sign-up for a $50/person lobster and filet deal.  So I can see why a server would phone it in a bit, they must assume we're cheapskates who are just trying to get a deal and won't tip according to full menu prices.  But after we ordered a couple rounds, a bottle of wine, additional appetizers, etc... he should have picked up on the potential.  He was aloof, didn't give us full attention even when we asked him questions... just really sort of... Chevy when we expect Cadillac  Anyway you dice it, we were disappointed with what we had thought up until that experience, was the crowning value Flemings brought to the table, exceptional service.  Without one of these three pillars (food, service, atmosphere) being better than their competitors, I struggle to justify dropping the time and cash to choose Fleming's over the dozen other options out there.

zqxJn_f2Zvp_OM0UVA7uXg.text: My husband and I had a date night at Fleming's last night and loved the food! We are steak people. We love a good filet that's a quality cut of meat and cooked right. Fleming's had an excellent cut of filet and it was cooked exactly how we asked on the first try. It had a great buttery flavor and was very tender. The mashed potatoes were delicious! The Brussels sprouts have the potential to be excellent, but they went too heavy on the oil and vinegar last night. The wedge salad was delicious as well. The blue cheese was perfectly creamy and the salad tasted fresh. Our server was very attentive, our glasses were never empty, and the restaurant was quiet. It was a slow night, which we didn't mind at all. So the only cons were the brussel sprouts weren't what I was hoping for, and I didn't actually like the bread that was served. I love bread, but their bread wasn't my favorite. Even with those two minor things in mind, we will definitely return! Obviously, it is priced a little higher than other steak houses, so if paying a lot of money for a good steak isn't your thing, Outback is a great option. You do also have to pay to park, but that's just city living for you! I highly recommend Fleming's!

gjScc8nt8uff_I7zTh8D-Q.text: We had a wonderful anniversary dinner at Flemings this year.  Their service and attention to detail is top notch.   Seriously, the steak was amazing...and the molten lava cake is second to none.    I highly recommend eating at Flemings.

l2LAsM4mEHskXFIS-f7mGQ.text: This is our best choice for a steakhouse in Charlotte.  Always great service and great quality food.  Great Bombay Saphire martini's with blue cheese olives ( the bartenders make the blue cheese olives fresh).  I travel all over the country and eat at many steak restaurants and this steak house is a must.  You won't be disappointed.

UJifYvIofmbHcBcf0A0uzw.text: This was my first time going to Flemings and I ending up eating there 2 times in the 3 nights I was in Charlotte.  As total food snob from San Francisco, there are very few memorable meals in Charlotte.  Flemings was a total surprise and made me thing otherwise.  The porcini mushroom ravioli appetizer with a salad was a great light dinner one night - paired with a yummy Spanish white wine.  The 2nd meal was on a very crowded night and we were a group of 10.  For someone who rarely eats beef I went all out and orderd the NY Strip steak.  It was really good.  Our waiter gave us a thorough analysis of all the types of steaks and recommendations on how to have them prepared for the best flavor - very helfpul.  I will go back to Flemings my next trip for sure.  I can't say the same for the other restuarants I have tried in Charlotte.

5E0OVVdlc-ADjIWlxYZX8g.text: Manager was extremely rude, pretentious, and off putting.  We were sitting at the bar when we noticed that the bar menu had some reasonably priced food items.  As we were originally going to grab a beer here and then go elsewhere for food, our group of 5 decided that we might as well stay here to eat instead.  I inquired with the hostess about sitting at a table in the dining room and ordering from the bar entree menu, and she assured me that the menu was available regardless of where we sat.  Once at our table, I asked the waiter if our table could see a bar food menu, and he stated that the menu was only available at the bar.  I explained our confusion, and he rightly deferred to the floor manager, who in turn deferred to the general manager.  I suppose this man was either just cranky or tired of people asking for the bar menu, because when I explained the miscommunication, he snapped and tried to kick us out of the restaurant.  I understand restaurant policy, but when a member of the staff is at fault, generally the manager will politely compromise or attempt to smooth things over.  Instead, we were publicly shamed for his employee's mistake.  We stood our ground, stating that we could have just remained at the bar (which was now full), and he stormed off to grab bar menus, which he slammed down onto the table.
