Disgusted, we decided to just tip the waiter for his time and leave.  We were clearly willing to spend money on drinks and food, but Fleming's was too proud to let us.  Terrible.

c19VZWVbU3PbjwT-Yl17Uw.text: I loved this steak house, little too much pepper and seasoning. The waitstaff was really great and I had a wonderful time

zHHn0me1a5FMesSnlZLEBw.text: The staff is patient, helpful and attentive. The suggestions made by our waiter were accurate. Great place for special occasion an with friends.

ZBZbgNOKyyaHDWoIKAGxew.text: Disappointed.  I was there for a business dinner last week and had a good, although not inspired, meal.  Our service was terrible.  It took forever to get a first round of drinks.  At the end of dinner we waited nearly 20 minutes to have them take my CC and pay the bill.  Embarrassing experience. Worst service I've had in Charlotte.

DobimtKtvWmFMdtxjhZ3sA.text: I picked Fleming's as a surprise birthday dinner and I have to say that they went above and beyond . We had a reservation for seven o'clock and were seated as soon as we got there. I was disappointed that for a slow night,(we went on a Sunday) they sat us next to another table but everything else made up for it. Our waiter(Brian) was attentive and very knowledgeable on the wine and all aspects of the meal. Our appetizers(onion soup and crab cakes) were the first clue on how good the meal was going to be. After a great house salad our tender and juicy rib-eyes came out with our sides of asparagus(yum) and a smoky cheesy  wonderful mac'n'cheese. Everything was so good I did not want the meal to end. An expensive meal but worth every penny.

RYqnOr-M0TdIp2SVkfX3ZQ.text: been traveling a lot for business and north carolina was one the stops.  the downtown section here was pretty pleasant and yes, there was quite a few college folks walking around hitting the happy hour clubs after work.  business travel is funny.  not nearly as glamourous as you might think.  that's why people that have to travel 60-90% for work automatically get a 40% salary increase over the stationary people.  if you want to brag about your salary, go shine shoes for a consulting company that will send you all over the place to do whatever and probably they will pay you $140K / year to do almost anything as long as you do it out of a suitcase Mon-Fri. but i digress.  we have no idea where to eat and were about to walk right by the non-descript and none-to-impressive from the outside, Flemings. until one other traveler, that comes to charlotte a lot, said the place we're standing in front of is one of the best in the whole area. flemings.  so we say, 'what the heck' and go inside.  we are immediately impressed and happy with the decision.  it's packed and the place is decked out to the tunes of millions (at least if it were california).  bar area was beautiful, dining area was impressive. the wait was only about 15 minutes. the wine list was very nice. the bartender gave us a couple fine glasses of red.  we were sat somewhat quickly.   i'm not a massive red meat eater but my filet mignon was really flavorful. the sides that came with it were perfect without being too big. ask the waiter on what's the best to go with each entree.  we had to coffee and port before heading out to our next destination, but the meal here was fantastic and we can definitely see this place being a regular visit when we're in town.

VnrV6m4jvDmTv0KGmsbttA.text: I went on Sunday with my younger cousin and I was pleased.  It happened to be restaurant week and we ordered the salmon.

OwK7Ld8SF-ocUQOczIxWmg.text: can't go wrong at a Flemings no matter where you are. Great service and great food.

Nm1KeC59RZq3e6V-Dg3jZQ.text: One word, lobster mac and cheese!!! YUM... ok that was three words but you got the idea. My hubby does not eat red meat so he was able to find an awesome chicken dish that was flavorful and oddly enough I didn't even get a steak, I got the scallops and....YUM.  Ok so I guess now I have to go back and actually get a steak but the calamari was excellent, our salads were fresh, the sides were delish so if you are looking for a steak review....this ain't it! :) But if everything else is so good I am sure it's safe to say they can prob prepare a steak 8-)

L0hfQfMiO7rT3xT4v2IPVg.text: Fleming's Steakhouse is a classy place.  The wait staff are very professional.  The food is expensive, but the New York Strip was the best I've ever had.  The baked potato was cooked to perfection.  We were not dressed for Fleming's, but were not made to feel out of place.

j3DDkB49f02N2cZfSoNfNQ.text: Traveling to Charlotte for the first time as an exhibitor, decided to make Flemings one of the restaurant to take my reps, since we had Mortons already. My overall experience was ok, the bone in rib eye although was good but not what i expect from a 5 Star establishment, it felt more chain like than i hoped for compared to other nice steak house. All around the atmosphere was good the service was great and the company of course is the most important. I most likely would not come again since there are so many other great steak house to choose from.

_3pdzTdbZGx-MmrHC9PPVw.text: Very nice decor, knowledgeable staff, robust wine list.  Ordered the Chilean sea bass with scallops plated on top of rissoto.  Amazing.  With fellow diners shared mac n cheese, sauteed spinach and potatos gratin - all were very good.  The potatos had a bit more complex flavor than the other sides, but all were very good.  Finished the meal with coffee and cheesecake with blueberries - both were excellent.  I would absolutely return!

tOnLIfj0TRfmDSa2IdF1bQ.text: We ate there in in December and were overcharged for our bill. I compared the itemized bill from Fleming's to the credit card statement and saw that the waitress had added an "additional tip" to the 20% tip we had already left her. I spoke with the manager two weeks ago who said he would call me back once he had reviewed the information. I had not heard back as of today. I sent an email on the main Fleming's website and just received a call back from the local manager stating that he had assigned it to be take care of by another employee and that he was sorry. He never seemed to actually care that we were overcharged and the time it took for me to get the bill straightened out with my credit card company. The manager acted as though it was not a big deal. I expected better customer service with a situation like this from a restaurant like Fleming's.

YnV_aW0SOFsaieBJ2aFB0g.text: Food and service great. Love all the wines by the glass. Problem:  they play top 40 music in the restaurant - and rather loudly. It cheapens the experience and ambience. I don't mind paying for an expensive dinner but I sure don't want to feel like I've paid $150 to eat in an Applebee's or  a bar, and that's the atmosphere created by the loud pop music.

bCC7OwfednVRu0jn7cXOIg.text: Everything was just ok, nothing spectacular.  We frequent Ruth's Chris and was expecting something similar for steak quality but no where close.  It took a long time to get drinks and food.  We will not choose this place over Ruth's Chris again.

h_jBWN7df0DvooZdztapvw.text: went there before a hornets game. very accomondating to get us to game on time, but not rushed. food was unbelievable!!!!!!! steaks done to perfection

zspRiAPBL3BGZlWg0fqvTw.text: Good substitute to Morton's or Ruth Chris-try the mac and cheese- seriously.

Y98-h8gZjNvVd27XxEzLww.text: I will stick to the quality of food because that is what I believe I am best at rating.  Everything was prepared well and my ribeye was 'medium' as promised.  Some of the sides were better than others and the appetizers were tasty.  That being said, this restaurant would not make the top of my list as far as steaks in Charlotte go.  Del Frisco's takes top honors, followed by Capital Grille and Ruth's.  This place isn't far behind.

Jcrqk_Nq1JptJSqW4mbyiw.text: I stayed across the street at the Omni and was in town before all of my friends arrived.  Saw Flemings and I had never been to this chain before so I figured I'd give it a shot.  First thoughts, the decor and atmosphere was definitely that of clean, modern steakhouse with dim lighting and dark colors with wooden accents.  It kind of reminded me of Dylan Prime back in NYC.  I made my way to the bar and ordered the seared ahi tuna and the burger ($6 each).    Both were cooked appropriately, a lot of red!  The burger was good but the tuna, woooooweeee!  I could have eaten a bunch of it.    The service was good and the bartender was helpful in providing directions for local nightlife aside from epicentre.  Would definitely go back and recommend to another.  Oh, they seemed to have a solid wine list that rotates seasonally as any respected somelier would do.

XIH5tJgwXjov6CNJL_XgFA.text: Flemmings was very tasty. It is one of my favorite steaks in Charlotte. They dont blacken the top under a broiler (like a lot of other steak places. I'm not fond of the top charing), instead it is a nice crispy dark brown. The steak was perfectly cooked for me. I'm a rare person and it had just enough cold in the middle to make me happy.  I also liked their take on the classic potatoes gratain. The Chedder and Jalapeno was a welcome change from the normal gruyere and nutmeg flavor.

bTjUWhOyCLLcZg74ZdrQ8w.text: 4.5?  OK. I am always looking for a bargain so when I saw gift cards at Costco ($80 for 2-$50 gift cards), I decided to try this place.   The decor of this upscale restaurant was very warm and comfortable and unpretentious (so I was told by my sister who says she felt out of place at the Capital Grille in Charlotte). We came on a Tuesday evening before New Years so the place seemed very empty. The free valet was great (especially when it cost $10 to park in the near garage). My husband ordered a martini which he claimed to be the best he had in memory (and I know he is picky because years ago I served him a martini that he sent back). We complimented the bartender and she asked us to stop by the bar for an after dinner drink.   For dinner, we ordered the cold seafood tower for two as an appetizer. This is the one reason why I did not give this place a 5-star. Although the presentation was beautiful, for $50 it was a bit of a rip-off. The crab legs, claws, lobster and shrimp were flavorless. I realize that it is difficult to get fresh seafood so far away from the coast, but for such a nice restaurant, they could have done better or taken it off the menu.   The menu was simple and the wine list long. We ordered the lamb chops, bone-in ribeye and bone-in NY strip. When we got our plates, we were amazed at how large the pieces of meat were. The lamb and steaks were cooked perfectly medium-rare. This is the best steak that I can remember--and I eat steaks very often. The meat was tender, seasoned perfectly, and had a nice crust on them. We also ordered the sauteed mushrooms, which were fine--nothing more to say about it. And then the onion rings...... Oh the onions rings, were so delicious--I have a weakness for all things fried. The rings were cut rather large (3/4" or so) so the onion still had good texture and the breading was crisp and light. It was an excellent balance of onion and breading.   Over-stuffed, we were unable to eat desserts so we headed to the bar to see the bartender. Although the dinning room was rather empty, the bar was packed and very lively. To our surprise, the bartender really hooked us up with our drinks.   Overall, not cheap, not fancy, but a great dining experience. I can't wait for them to open in the Domain in Austin, TX.

js-hvEFXviAadTmS8ky5tg.text: my two favorite parts of this meal - the peach sparkling martinis and the chocolate molten lava cake, they both make me happy and both are worth returning to flemings for...probably sitting in the bar area and just enjoying those two items.  fleming's overall has very nice ambiance even though they are a bit on the pricey side - reminds me of a place you would see in an old mobster movie, maybe even dick tracy only there are alot of charlotte bank elite wearing ties there...not really my style :)   i enjoyed scallops for my dinner, my husband had salmon and other folks at our table seemed to really enjoy their various filet mignon and peppercorn strip steaks.   we had the calamari (YUM), ahi tuna and sweet chile shrimp as appetizers and the only real downfall was the 20 minute wait from the time we ordered our apps to the time our dinner order was taken.  all in all it was an A-OK experience

BWqtbHeh4wq6fUbu-P-4fg.text: We went last night for Charlotte restaurant week; the 3 for $30 "deal." Except at Fleming's everything is al a carte so add in the wine & sides with dinner & there goes that deal! The food was very average. Almost tasted premade & heated up. The service was OK (not typical to fine dining if this is the class Fleming's belongs to). I wouldn't recommend this restaurant nor would I go back.

fpmn1-gRCTtQQ1VS5JC7vA.text: My husband & I went to Fleming's this past weekend and all I can say is AMAZING!!! The ambience was amazing, the service was beyond amazing, the food was PHENOMENAL...We had the crab cakes for our appetizer and OMG if they weren't the best crab cakes we've ever eaten. I had the filet & my husband had the ribeye, which I wasx jealous of because the ribeye had the most amazing flavor we have ever tasted. My filet was delicious, but I still prefer Ruth Chris's filet over any filet I'v ever had, but it was still amazing. I did enjoy their signature scalloped potatoes. I do admit I was nervous to try them b/c I don't like spicy foods and this potato has japaleno's, but you would never know it. Our server was the best and overall I rate this Steakhouse in my Top 2. If you have the budget, you absolutely HAVE to come to Flemings...You will not be disappointed!

NYXfF70to2UiVwK7HCyHMw.text: Just because a restaurant has white tablecloths does not mean it has good food but reviewers of Flemings must be so impressed with the tablecloths that they overlooked the taste of food.  Worse restaurant I've been to in a while, and that includes the food I am forced to eat at the airport.   I had  fish, that tasted institutional - something off high school cafeteria menu. It was an insult to the sea.  The service was good, which is why this place got two stars and not one.

fNW8Ou2X6AkuOwHnk0XdWQ.text: Great steak house.  Consistently good food.  I would call it the second best place next to the Capital Grill.

5ZocdWPP86k3PrurjHEMjQ.text: I'm a fan. Great to have a  more 'modern' selection for a steakhouse than CG. I'm not especially a fan of the Epi - particularly if you are going to get dressed and spend this kind of money... but Fleming's delivers great food and solid service. Atmosphere is fresh and modern, cozy and contemporary. They have a few extra touches, using your last name here and there after you are seated. A breath of fresh air relative to the other stale steakhouses in Uptown.

44U4rPS4DnlR8pFFWohbEg.text: Food is great! Service is good. Steak was wrong the first time out but was promptly fixed.

Z_DQ0iGgVoqBLAmv22QjAQ.text: Went the Fleming's last night for our anniversary dinner. I have never been there before but my husband had a few dinner meetings there. The food was Ok but the service was awful. The waiter tried to push on us a bottle of wine and seemed disappointed that we elected to buy wine by glass. After an appetizer I was looking forward to a piece of warm bread with butter but received none (on occasion you might need to wait for a fresh batch of bread but I looked around and other tables had it, overall not a busy dining room). I finally asked for some bread and the water waiter brought it to our table - no plates (which were taken away after appetizer). I had no place to put the bread on. Our waiter showed up and instead of correcting the problem asked if we wanted another round of wine - I told him I would like bread plates. By the time we got the plates the food was here so I gave up on the bread but at this point was irritated that I needed to keep asking to be attended. My steak was tasty but rather salty. My husband's sea bass was OK. We did not bother with desserts - I did not want to stay longer. Unfortunately, not a great experience overall - on account of our anniversary the restaurant did give us a small box of truffles to go - nice touch but a bit too late. Will not go there again - should have gone to The Capital Grill (remains my favorite steak house in town).

B82TbedfI4v8eIFq6jsUqQ.text: I LOVE Flemings.  I've been to all of the steak joints in town and this one is my favorite.  Great bar, too, especially if looking for a cozy upscale one.  Also, MUST go weeknights between 5-7 (I think) for their $6 appetizers.  AWESOME!!!  I mean two apps is one nice meal.  One of the apps is a huge prime burger with onion rings.  FOR $6.  They make great drinks too.  I love their appletinis.  Whenever I'm downtown for a business dinner, I always suggest Flemings.  It is always a big hit, too.  Location is great because you can also check out the other places in the Epicenter, too.  I LOVE FLEMINGS!!!

ZC0EgAJVpI5h_na8AnRKQQ.text: Best run restaurant in Charlotte. Great food and the best service around. We go all the time and are never disappointed.

iODkGRXGNCZ_SdNv4d61xw.text: Its was our Anniversary so we decided to go to Charlotte and also reserve a table in this restaurant. Upon arriving 15 min early we were greeted with the Host and she told us that our table will be available at 8:30pm which is the time of our reservation. It was totally fine for us to wait since we are early but when 8:30pm arrived she did not acknowledge us or even just tell us that they still haven't reserve our table which made us upset. Then, after maybe 20 more minutes we were finally seated and she finally apologized for the wait which makes us feel better. Thankful for our server Scott, he was amazing and very attentive. He always checked up on us. He also told us that since we had to wait for so long that we could choose either a free appetizer or free dessert. We then ordered our meal and we ordered both of our steaks medium rare. After we got our food and began eating we noticed the steaks were more like medium well to well done. But we were so hungry that we ate them without complaint. Luckily, The Manager Jaime Schutz checked on us and apologized for the wait and she also noticed that our steaks were not cook to our order. She asked us if we both wanted another steak but we declined since we were already half way through eating them. So she offered to pay for our meal which was awesome! We also got the dessert, cheesecake, and it was great. So overall we are very pleased with our waiter and the manager. The only reason this isn't a five star is because of the initial wait and our food not being correct initially. We will definitely go back.

pHOw6K1awceZ5Pqqlrft4Q.text: Been their twice. Did not like their bone in rib eye. Both times I had to sent my steak back. Great place to have a drink. The bar faces the main street.

FJQOX3UcfbRcOcjWX8vWhQ.text: I went to Fleming's for Charlotte Restaurant Week. It was a delicious meal and great service. They mix your martini's at your table! I had the wedge salad to begin with, which was delicious. The Bleu Cheese is almost as good as my dad's homemade.  For my second course I had the 8oz fillet. It was cooked perfectly. The seasoning was a little spicy but not over powering. As a side item I tried the Parmesan mashed potatoes and the Fleming's potatoes. Both were excellent, if not a little expensive.  For dessert I had the blueberry cheesecake, it was delicious; even better the next morning for breakfast.   It was a great experience to have but I do not think I would be able to afford to eat here too often, maybe on business dinners.

-cKFA4YLDyLoMeDismGHHA.text: Another chain steak house... Woopdeedoo... Actually, this place had the best peppercorn NY strip that I've ever had. Their F17 sauce (?sp) to accompany it was outstanding. Pair it with a blue cheese wedge salad and finish with a glass of Justin 2008 cabernet and it's absolute heaven. Oh, and the decor ain't bad either.

XbF1cRRVG0ipCd27EqUeog.text: I had the ribeye and it was one of the best I ever had. The service was also great. I highly recommend.

-vlJhf7ld3onVb4wEpEbwA.text: First time at Flemings. It was great. I ordered the special Oscar fillet Mignon. It was lights out good. Overall a great experience.

4vnK-cG4uQ_FhYSkfegqfA.text: One of my favorite steakhouses in the city. Been to ruth cris, been to del friscos, morton's ect but out of all of them flemings does it right. Some of the best side dishes, lobster mac and cheese, garlic potatoes both very good.  Hip location to in the epicenter.

Pa6jGLgA2TzhreQR07q8yw.text: We are happy to hear Fleming's now offers a children's menu! To hear about our family night experience, Full story on the blog : ModernStyleMom.com/charl...

1uEiKv5T2SsV5f1Djk8iPQ.text: Superb experience starting from the service to the food. Upscale restaurant without being stuffy. Our server was professional, attentive and friendly. Excellent drinks and wine selection. All the dishes we ordered were very well made, cooked to perfection and seasoned with taste. Starter: sweet chile calamari. Small plate: seared ahi tuna. Entrees: main filet mignon with truffle-poached lobster on top; prime bone-in ribeye. Sides: crispy Brussels sprouts with bacon. Desserts: New York cheesecake; carrot cake.

photos.caption: Photo of Fleming's Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sweet Chile Calamari
Photo of Fleming's Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Carrot cake
Photo of Fleming's Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Seared Ahi Tuna*

K0FtHPCpEl3VQZ2MMLjVbA.text: Had an amazing time here for my mother's birthday dinner. Their management team let me come in to coordinate and decorate hours before my reservations which said a lot due to past experiences. They also assisted to make sure my party had a great dinner experience. Food was exquisite and meat was freshly cooked to high standards. Definitely recommend for a date night/ dinner party cause the setting really sets the mood for either occasion. Thanks to Aaron and his team for the great experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Fleming's Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States

1aMvfTwO8PEacisKZh1KpA.text: Filet Steak was horrendous. First one had fat all over it. The manager (William) was extremely nice and respectful and gave me a new one. However, the second was slightly better. Also, the lobster bisque was average at best. Best part of the night was the service. Hard pass on the rest.

-PCKkuC_qEhncaaqt4WUeQ.text: Fantastic meal- huge filet mignon cooked perfectly. Creamed spinach was the best I've ever had. Caesar salad with grilled shrimp. Bread basket with whipped butter and lavash! Yum! Great service and can't go wrong with Honig Cabernet Sauvignon!

Y84xXNIEPPKIavo7Q03tdg.text: Fleming's is amazing!!! The burgers are excellent and they have a great wine selection! Also this place is 100% wheelchair accessible (even the bar!) for my fellow wheelchair users who need to know this info when trying a new place. William is the bomb .com!! I will definitely be back

v_J5gNhT4qanTzMHtEUKKA.text: KThe ambience allowed is the only downside, but it's a pretty big one. Charlotte hosts many travelers, domestic and international, because of its popularity for being a banking business hub. This means Fleming's would do well to make sure their clientele is aware of and respecting this fact.  The entire time having my solo meal at the bar (i do this a lot as a consultant and out of respect to the waiters in the dining room who are hoping for at least two diners), I felt like I was in an Irish pub NOT un upscale restaurant/bar. The three people sitting next to me should've been cut off or asked to quiet down, not allowed to yell obscenities or things like "titty bar!" Or "he got the black AND Hispanic fever!" The food is great, the wine selection is great but ambience overpowered it all. For that, the experience is a 3- star.  UPDATE: I told the bartender and manager and they responded admirably. I do not seek and actively reject comps, but allowed them to get me a glass of wine on the house. I was invited back, to show that they will take measures to correct this issue. I'm not back for 6 months and I'm looking forward to the visit.

DrqzQh3rHYeF58aXU7iJbQ.text: A great place for prime steaks and seafood. I've been to a few Fleming's from Miami to NY and in between and I've never been any less than delighted. Fleming's Takes pride in being a classy restaurant with excellent and professional service. And this Fleming's in Charlotte did not disappoint if I could've given it 6 stars I would've!  Definitely will be back on my next trip to a city I live. The Queen City, NC.

U47NZQROlxt6_Hh_m0D2Og.text: Great experience tonight at Fleming's.  Our server Moe was so professional, knowledgeable, and courteous.  He explained everything, made suggestions and was accommodating to our every need.  Moe should be teaching a class in exceptional customer service.  Our food was perfect as was our entire night.  Thanks Moe and Fleming's for a perfect date night.

5yDayo7_w1NSPyfiAjmNXQ.text: We went to Fleming's today, for Mother's Day, with a party of 21, 8 of which were kids 10 and under. Our servers were excellent. Larry, Maurice and Jose really made it a great experience. We had 19 steaks ordered and all of them came out at the temperature they were ordered.  In my limited experience eating at high end steakhouses, that's unheard of. Usually the steaks come out well below the temperature ordered. The sides were delicious, the desserts were amazing. 5 stars all day long.

bXZQF6z_dS1tIoWUTvUf_Q.text: Hands down THE best food and service we have ever had. It all started with a reservation through Megan Martin (Private Dining Director). She helped me every step of the way with options and solutions for my wife's 40th Birthday. We ended up with a party of 18 people and the service couldn't have been any better. I did not get the manager's name but he was extremely nice and showed everyone to the table and made sure everything was to our liking. "Mo" was our server (wish I could remember his full name) he was on top of it! He seemlesly took everyone's drink order. Waiting for drink or food wasn't even anywhere near an issue. We all had or drink within minutes. Mo's recommendations for wine were excellent. He took our food orders... I have never been anywhere that could even come close to matching the speed and quiality of this meal. The kitchen staff (who did an outstanding job) had everyone's meal cooked to perfection and ready all at the same time. Absolutely amazing. To be totally honest (because all reviews should be) only one hiccup, my cousin got a chopped salad instead of a wedge salad chopped, this extremely minor mixup was remedied by Mo in less than one minute. Our entire evening at Fleming's in Charlotte was outstanding. This will not be our last time nor will it be our last event there. THANK YOU everyone from the staff, kitchen, Mo, Megan, Management, and corporate for providing the baseline of how all restaurant experiences should be. I can't thank you enough for making my wife's 40th birthday dinner an amazing event. We highly recommend Fleming's Steak House in Charlotte NC.

-Obzlna_R4DfW1p9RIGg0w.text: Was invited to a birthday party on a football night so imagine how torn I was so only option was to split my time . Decided to only have cocktails but heard the food was really good. Although I've eaten at a Fleming's before I was more interested in their cocktails this night. Will definitely be back to try their food.  Another football fanatic and myself ordered the Bourbon Basil Bash which we thought would be pretty strong with a nice herbal taste which I got that but felt it was to sweet. This would be a great summer drink for brown drinkers.  With the Basil bash being more on the sweet side and we wanted something a bit stronger, we ordered a Makers in the ice which you can never go wrong with that.  Since this was a private party, we had one server which I felt there should have been 2 due to the number of guests. Our server was in assuming o overwhelmed since it literally took almost 15-20 mins to get our second drink. The waiter was extremely nice, apologetic and welcoming. He recommended drinks and also pre-planned meals from the birthday menu. Would have had more drinks if the drinks came out quicker.  Overall a great experience & the birthday boy had a great time. Will be back to try the steak and another Basil Bash with less sweet and more basil

nSWx13oZNuH85bC0JTMeSg.text: Flemings, like Mortons or Capital Grill is a high end steak house. While you can not go wrong eating at any of these places, I think that when it comes to service I would give the edge to Flemings.  We were three couples and after dinner one of the women could not decide between two after dinner drinks. With out a word our server brought both to the table, at no charge, so she and the rest of the table could taste them both. The pork chop was excellent and I enjoyed the creamed spinach and onion rings; the others liked the mushrooms. Wine was standard steak house selection and prices, no complaints. They do a nice pour for their cocktails. If I was nit  picking I would say that I do not like paying $15 for valet parking when eating at that level of an establishment; just charge me more and frank the parking. Flemings is an enjoyable dinning out night. Check out their frequent customer type card.

3PAd4m6SJZ71vuK8Edib1g.text: My parents and I stumbled upon this place while visiting Charlotte this past weekend. Although we weren't fully aware of the steep prices until we looked at the menu, we were pleasantly surprised with the entrees and sides that we ordered.  I ordered the Miso Glazed Chilean Sea Bass entree and it was SUPERB! I ate every single big of it. It was full of flavor and the miso glaze really put everything together. I would definitely order it again without a doubt. We also ordered the asparagus and chipotle cheddar macaroni and cheese. The mac and cheese dish was delicious.  Overall our experience was great, but I couldn't give it a full five stars because of the steep prices. This is definitely a place to go for an intimate celebration (anniversary, birthday, etc.) or a special occasion rather than a regular Saturday night meal.

K8IWIbfI3DGGjgAHBu-rbA.text: This was my first visit to Flemming's and I'm sure there will be more visits... just not often because it does have a higher price point. I will say you get what you pay for. Our waiter Larry was fantastic! He knew we were dining prior to a show and he kept us on task better than we did ourselves. I ordered the surf and turf from Rigo's Special menu which was a filet and salmon over a bed of mashed potatoes and topped with micro greens. My steak melted in my mouth. I love steak and have gotten steak from several fine dining establishments but this was one of the best steaks I've ever had. I cannot wait to go back to try the orange miso glazed sea bass. I saw it on the menu and can't stop thinking about it. Whenever it may be,  I'm definitely looking forward to my next visit!

f4kUTYAOWUb2j1YekBa0Kw.text: I was having an amazing afternoon. The bar tender was phenomenal as well as the wait staff. I sat down to eat with a friend and ordered a beef carpaccio, one of my favs. Yes, we had a few cocktails and then I was accosted by the manager, William Edwards. He made me leave ina very abusive manner and made me feel like a douche. I paid my $95 tab at the bar and left $100 in cash for the bartenders who did a great job as hosts. Other than William Edwards who actually called the police on me, it was a great experience. The police laughed at his insane behavior and I bid them goodnight. I normally give 5 stars. Based on William Edwards, I can not. Don't go here to have a good time. In New Orleans he would be run off on a freight train. I would love to say how much I loved the steak but I never got the chance.

iVicXfvPHZAZWWAp62eRAw.text: I eat at Fleming's around the country and I could usually expect a pretty good, 4 or 5 star steak dinner. This would have been the case with all things, here in Charlotte, except for one thing:  The steak!  I am a filet eater simply because I have no tolerance for fat or gristle yet my petit filet was riddled with it. Every other bite was a gaggy effort to get this thing chewed enough to swallow it. Bleck!  Honestly, I have had better steaks at low-end steak places at a third the cost.   I had a delicious chopped salad and the onion rings, which were also very good. Ice cream was desert along with a $16 Cabernet which was decent. My tab exceeded $100 which is a price point that I expect something more than gaggy gristle.   It will be some time before I return to Fleming's, anywhere.

v_t7HJ9HTdquZCQLBQLaoQ.text: We had the best time at Fleming's. From the salad with the in house made dressing to the walnut pie and cheesecake for dessert this place is wonderful. We got there early and had a great drink at the bar, I always order a French Martini just to test the bartender's skill set and I was not disappointed what so ever.   Our waiter, Azer Cokljat gave us great suggestions for pairings and we ended up splurging on a bottle, per his recommendation. The wine was fabulous. We both had the filet a la oscar and it also could not have been better. Crab meat can be hit or miss and they had delicious lump crab and it was fresh and you could tell a wonderful quality.   Their sides are also wonderful. We chose to have the creamed spinach and the Fleming's potatoes. I am a huge lover of jalapenos and the potatoes were fantastic. Dessert was also very good but I didn't get to eat too much after stuffing my face with all the amazing food that came beforehand.   We will 100% be returning and asking for Azer Cokljat as our waiter. Thank you for a lovely date night.

photos.caption: Photo of Fleming's Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Wonderful meal! Jalapeño potatoes, creamed spinach and filet a la oscar! With great wine recommendations!

C7FCpyxFBv4r9LNwXouo1w.text: I made a reservation for my boyfriend birthday. It was supposed to be special that's why I pick the restaurant. I gave multiple hits to our server that it was his bday . However when we got there the service was kinda off but we didn't want to Focus on it. (He questioned if we were gonna pay together or spared) We both order drinks it was fast came before the bread also the bread was some hard. Appetizer came it was good then we order a blotted of red wine. We finish a glass and our entree's wasn't ready we didn't mind the wait. Later the food arrived my boyfriend steak was under cooked he asked for medium well and what he got was well Under done and my lobster was under seasoned. The side order was messed up and it took a while for the restaurant to correct the mistake for veggie side. Thank you for taking out of the bill. The roasted color flowers was Robbery; After my meal came with a pumpkin cheese cake.  The other table had a birthday so they were singing happy birthday. Yes I was jealous and WANTED FOR MY BOYFRIEND BIRTHDAY!. We left disappointed and total -$309 we left the server tips $40!.  I'm very disappointed for it being such a big restaurant and many good recommendations. However we didn't receive a good service or we'll cooked food. For the price that we paid for.

JadfBHX-Nm_B7yggD8fjog.text: This was probably the best filet mignon I have ever tasted! It was seasoned well and cooked to perfection. The wedge salad and Brussels sprouts were also super tasty.  The only thing I didn't appreciate was the poor greeting by the hostesses. When we first arrived we were told the dining room was full and to wait for a table at the bar. There weren't any tables available so we went back to the hostesses and asked how long it would be for a table in the dining room. We were told 15-20 minutes. It would've been nice to just go that route the first time. Then we were actually seated literally 3 minutes later. Why waste our time sending us to the bar??   The food definitely made the experience worth it.

yD1PgBdn9qfxbXLuaBuIDw.text: Very loud, companion sitting right next to me could not hold a conversation.  Steaks and sides were ok.  We had both recently been to a Ruth's Chris in NJ and this place was nowhere near that in food enjoyment.  The extensive by-the-glass wine list is nice, maybe a bit overwhelming.

etrda1cbRWP9atkkfCzXEg.text: Great atmosphere and fantastic food. Family friendly restaurant but also a wonderful restaurant for a romantic dinner. Everything from appetizers to dessert was fabulous. Loved the digital wine list :)

fBZxvo7AgJ396wWc-MM5Jg.text: Flemings is another chain that made it's way into Epicentre. I like the ambiance upon entering, and the staff is pretty good. The bar area is a little small for my liking with the bar booth right up to the bar. If it's a slow night, not a big deal, but if the bar is 2-3 deep, eating in the bar area may be a little cramped.   Hit this up on a recent restaurant week, and it was good, but I wasn't overwhelmed. I'd make the excuse of restaurant week, but some restaurants really step it up and make sure their customers leave wanting come back for more and spend the $$$. Flemings didn't do that for me, though I will be back to try the full menu. Loved the bread and spread choices! Steak was cooked through nice for me, but was over seasoned, which made my water go away fast. Jalapeno potatoes were good and went bye-bye fast. Enjoyed the cheesecake for dessert, though the 2nd one we had...mousse, was so-so.

yLRr7YQ7jq9VmP25Oq4Hww.text: I have generally enjoyed this place for work functions and dinner to be up front.  The service is very good, food is higher chain steakhouse and acceptable, but after being denied the courtesy of a parking validation only because we had eaten in the bar area (approximately $100 for 2 people), I got a bad taste in my mouth.  The management has informed me politely that regardless of the check, as we went for happy hour (which is every day including Sundays from 5 to 7), they could not offer the validation. Their happy hour is indeed a great deal, so I can see the reasoning there. I would like to see them base that off of amount spent instead though.   Review updated, thanks David for the explanation.

NU7fbwBXCgV8zsAuN_W4Zg.text: This is one of the best steak houses I have been in. I love Chima for the variety but the taste of the filet mignon here was amazing. the service was great as well and the variety of wines they have is incredible. It is a pricey for our taste (if drinks included) but this is not an every weekend restaurant... the only thing is that it was a bit dark, the atmosphere, i got a bit dizzy at some point but the rest was wonderful.

NyfKLY985cA4YqxVmtV9aA.text: So I've waited about 20 or so days before writing a review hoping to maybe see my wife's perspective as she loved the place. I share some of her enthusiasm but on an overall scale I have to move down to "it's ok". I ordered my usual ribeye, creamed spinach, proceeded by french onion soup. Soup was good, hot, and flavorful. Not perfect but definitely good. My wife ordered the Flemings Potatoes the house specialty with cream, jalapenos and cheddar cheese. These arrived au gratin fashion. The jalapenos flavor was almost nonexistent with little to no taste. I had expected it to be bold flavor. The potatoes were a bit undercooked also. The spinach was creamy and had good flavor and the only drawback to it was the size of the portion. Portion is barely enough for two people. Steaks came in a timely fashion but when they set mine down it just didn't look great. It is said that you eat with your eyes first so when it starts off with a tad disappointment it probably affects the rest of the experience. If your first impression is "wow; that looks good" this will usually carry you through some of your idiosyncrasies you walk through the front door with. They came up short in quelling those with the steak they set in front of me. My wife had the filet. It looked good but it's a filet and it stands on its own in my experience. You can buy choice grade cut from your local grocery store butcher and it will still look good even after you've flipped it way to many times on your grill!  I've read about the service being an issue in other reviews and I believe it is a result of a "Let them Enjoy" service policy. What ends up happening instead of your waiter passing by your table while giving it the once over to see if anything is needed without being intrusive, he ends up hanging out with the other servers shooting the breeze. My empty water went unnoticed and I had to dip into my reserve which I retrieved from my wife's glass while she looked away when suddenly prompted by a phantom "you see that" look in the opposite direction! I'm not a fan of the hovering server touching something on your table every three seconds, I remember when I was a kid some long time ago, my dad took us to a restaurant in Kittery Maine called the Whistling Oyster, they had what I recall seemed like 17 servers and every time you put down your roll it was replaced with a new hot one and your glass wasn't allowed to be drunk out of without being refilled. I remember simply picking up the glass and holding it to my mouth to see if the dude was actually going to put water in a full glass. So nuisance service no, but you would like some basic professionalism and not have to suck on your ice at 200+- a dinner! The absoute highlight of the night was the floor manager who brought out our valet ticket and our car was ready when we went out the door. Kudos to him! I'll go back because my wife likes it but not before I offer up the alternatives.  #

LZuB5l7KNbis3lJRmPGSZw.text: Fantastic place to go for a great night uptown. Took my future wife for her birthday and enjoyed the food as well as the service. The staff was very professional and friendly as well as respectful. Definitely, I will keep coming back.

sUSq6x_-FV8neuv1g8X-2A.text: My wife and I had a gift card and so we tried it. I had the rack of lamb and it was cooked properly, the quality of the meat was good and the taste on the mark. My wife is a Vegetarian and there were no choices for her at all. We sort of expected this so it's not factored into the rating.  The wine selection is quite good. Lots of wine by the glass too which is cool because you don't have to commit to an extremely over priced bottle.  The sides were over cooked and drowned in butter.  On a whole - this place was OK. My opinion is that Ruth's Chris is a little bit better. I guess I may be picky but I still prefer my back yard and a bottle of wine over the False sense of entitlement that fills the air of these restaurants.

8yVFsUPyKKaQNaQkGS40CQ.text: Disappointed after good reviews.  Walked in without a reservation, hosts told me 30 minutes for a table  (with a half full restaurant).  I went to the bar, then came back and asked about the half full restaurant...they still said 30 minutes (with that super stiff smile thing going on, you know the smile that's not a smile?).  I sat at the bar...and ten minutes later was seated at one of the empty tables in the half empty restaurant.  Server Jared was A+, excellent.  Unfortunately the wine I wanted was out.  Ordered the sliced mignon, which was VERY good but the risotto cakes were mushy and luke warm, as if just scooped from a lingering bowl.  I had the "new school" or some such caesar salad - um....limp and nothing too original, hardly generous with the prosciutto, which was the exciting addition.  The bread was excellent, as were the dips that came with it.  I asked for steamed spinach which came with onions (not explained on the menu) and server immediately took it back after he learned that I was allergic to onions.  $61, not feeling so good about that.   For the money, I'm headed to BLT Prime next time, at least I know what I'm getting there.  Maybe it was because it wasn't a buzzing night, but this place just seemed to be coasting.

w77Yg2Xq4UGY6nRrKsYn_A.text: Good food, impeccable service, and the price is right. I'm a fan of Flemings. A friend and I went for the prime rib special. I expected smaller portions but I was wrong. Large salads, full portions of their wonderful prime rib, sides and fantastic desserts all for $34.95 per person.  Come on, I'm not sure you could buy all the ingredients and make this meal yourself for that. The wedge salad was cold and crisp with lots of bacon and huge chunks of bleu cheese. The Prime rib was very tender and flavorful. I ordered mine rare and it came medium rare, but I didn't complain and it was still good. Sides of sauteed green beans and Flemings potatoes were huge and very tasty. We each had our fill of the sides and there was plenty left over. The dessert menu, while uninspired, contains all the classics and they are all made in-house and done extremely well. Free parking is the icing on the cake. Next time I'm in the mood for red meat and classic sides and desserts...I'm flying to Flemings.

wy8DpsxIPQJ9oO1iO2DVOg.text: Fantastic Steaks. Ate here a second time on another business trip.  Service was great. The place was almost full and was restaurant lively on a Monday night!  Great food... salad was superb, steak (flawless filet), flavorful sides (Fleming's potatoes) and vegetable sides were also perfect (spinach). Fleming's is a superb choice--maybe the best steakhouse in Charlotte!  Great for work dinner, couples or friends. Great wine list, great decor. My only minor complaint is that this location seems to let the host stand go empty sometimes--had to a wait a few minute to be seated. Other locations have 2-3 staff at host stand all the time. Manager should fix this here. Otherwise, A+.

TT5t3_SdI3LeOPD1rFr_8g.text: We ate here this past Saturday and were treated like royalty.  From start to finish our waiter Josh (or maybe Jeff) was excellent.  He described the specials to us and we decided to branch out from our normal filet to the shared tomahawk for two.  This came with 3 sauces, the marscapone was my favorite-just outstanding.  THe owner/manager (Tom) came out to present it and sliced/served it for us.  It was just an outstanding flavor to the steak.  They even wrapped up the bone for us to take home to our dog.  To start off they even split the wedge salad for us as they mentioned it was a nice portion and good to share.  To top it off they heard us discussing we were getting married soon and surprised us with a treat.  The food was just delicious and the service was outstanding.  The chocolate truffles they sent us home with were absolutely delicious.  We are big wine/chocolate people and order special chocolate, but this was some of the best we've had.  There are many great steakhouses in Charlotte, but Fleming ranks at the top.  This great service really puts it above the others.

aYKrkO6sYgwYNQKVGNqPcg.text: I took my girlfriend here on Saturday night for Valentine Dinner. I had looked at different resturants and decided to give it a try. She was excited about us going. I would first start off saying the atmosphere was very nice. The waiter was great gave great service and was over the top in helpfulness. What I mean he went the extra mile. The only True complaint is the price for what you get. She had the filet mignon which was under cooked that she couldn't finish it not that there was much to eat anyways. I had the Peppercorn Steak which was just ok. I just feel that with all the side items which you purchase seperately that the main course item would be larger. I felt we both walked away hungry. Would I go back probably not as I rather try somewhere else next time.

LojL2Xk2MVzOA9ShHAm7Dg.text: The best thing about Flemmings was the sales pitch at the beginning of the meal. They compared them selves to Capital Grille but in my mind CG is way better. Don't get me wrong the Flemmings steak was good. But is it on par with CG? Not to me at least not at that price point. I know it's about the atmosphere too, but even that I was not terribly impressed with. Good but lacking somehow.

f2CtwN-M_mrqJ6voo9Qspg.text: We reviewed several steak houses, and based on Yelp chose this one. The environement and staff were welcoming and accomadating.  We showed up with three more guests on on the reservation.  Service was fast and professional.  All of the steaks and food was very tasty. The sides like cream spinich and the, Flemming potatos were memorable.  Great for a business meal, meal with friends, romantic or even with family.   Most certainly will go back, when in Charlotte

tcUG0hth2ksRgpVk1u6u6Q.text: One of the best quality steaks you can get.  Forget the other overpriced guys.  Food and service was better.

1x7sGSjlr-HfbvHhqCwtsg.text: An update - due to my review and bad experience the manager did contact me. I will give Flemings another chance. I appreciate a business taking feedback and improving.

CVKXI0rpHG84OnJJvKqEiw.text: Service was terrible and food was average.  Couldn't believe it for the price we paid.  First and last time we will go.

k1U2b2vNuSh2pT6z-c3BiA.text: Wow, pretty nice place overall! Very good service and a great steak. The potatoes that were served with the light fillet were very good. Spicy grilled shrimp I added to my steak were the best I have had anywhere--cooked just right. The place is a bit pricey for a regular night on the town, but my favorite of all the high end steak houses I've tried. Give it a try!

JpnABrDzy6r3G9RgoxI0vA.text: Charlotte has a pretty good selection of Steakhouses; Flemmings is just one example.  Flemmings is a pretty classy place with the prices to match it.  It was pretty busy the night we stopped in there so clearly it much be popular amongst both the locals and the business travelers.    The service was pretty good and professional.  The food was very good, but it should be based on the prices.  Given the choice I would probably try the Capital Grille.

kDuLj_NuHxLyHsZWBPJOxQ.text: Now this is a steakhouse Lovely atmosphere  Got seated right away Caesar salad was heavenly  My Wagyu Beef was to die for Profiteroles amazing, Cafe Latte spot on I wish there was a Fleming close to me

photos.caption: Photo of Fleming's Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States

kzVNHM3zN3cAs1A5RfYQGQ.text: I had a fantastic dinner experience here!   Everything from the service to food presentation and taste was perfect.   We started with the Chilled Seafood Tower. My goodness! This has everything! It has king crab, ahi tuna poke, shrimp cocktail and lobster tails. This is definitely the way you start your meal!   For dinner I ordered the aged ribeye cooked medium. We also shared side of macaroni and cheese, asparagus, carrots and brussel sprouts with bacon.   My steak was cooked to perfection. It was so tender and so flavorful! I really enjoyed all the side hit my favorites were the brussel sprouts with bacon!   For dessert I ordered the cream brulee. If you can manage to save room for it...this is absolutely worth it.   I can't wait visit this place again!

photos.caption: Photo of Fleming's Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Prime Dry-Aged Ribeye

6aItf_LcixNdelwdjqHhvQ.text: This was my first time here and I went with a large group. They were very accommodating seeing as we had people coming all at different times and there were lots of other larger groups and regular size parties when we were there.   The inside is nice, feels fancy and clean, much like other higher-end steakhouses. The menu had a nice variety of wine, drinks, steak, chicken and seafood. Our food was very good and the drinks were good too. I ordered a mixed drink that had strawberry in it, and it is was so refreshing, I ordered another one!  There was nothing different about Fleming's from any other higher-end steakhouse, like Ruth's Chris, in my opinion. Very pricey for a decent entree and fancy atmosphere, but if that's your thing, then this place is for you!

_b0DP3YqqpLxxD5SKBdtVg.text: Wow! This steakhouse in Charlotte is at the top of my list for GREAT FOOD!! We were in town for a baseball tournament at UNCC and decided to have a night out without the kids! What a great choice we made. The service was ok but the food made up for ANY mishaps!! I had the 14oz Ribeye with asparagus, and Mac n Cheese which was to die for!! My husband had the filet with mashed potatoes and cream spinach!! This food was great!!  I love the atmosphere! Being a steakhouse you'd think casual or business attire but Fleming's was very relaxed and laid back! Which I LOVED! Like I stated before we were in town for baseball and wanted a good steak.

B2VWycQ3m2xfQB4UTBO3DA.text: My wife and I celebrated our anniversary here and I was so impressed from beginning to end. As soon as we walked in and told them our name, we were told "Happy Anniversary" and seated right away. Our table was decorated and there was an anniversary card on the table for us. Every person taking care of us told us happy anniversary as well. The service was excellent the entire night.  My wife ordered burrata to start and it was probably one of the best that I have had. I would definitely order it again.   I ordered the Filet and Lobster tail special. It came with my choice of salad and I chose the ceaser, which was very good. My filet, I ordered medium and it came more medium rare, but it was still excellent. The lobster tail was cooked perfectly and tasted amazing. For my dessert, I went with the Key Lime pie. It was just as good as everything else.  Overall, the food and the service were top notch. I expected nothing less from Flemings and they beat my expectations.

wGrTdTuwMoBbF6fvzSnvEA.text: Best steaks in town.  I had a ribeye which was an amazing cut.  Then had a New York which was also a super cut.  The searing they do is what makes it so amazing.  Great staff and service as well!

Y6IVBAnTMJrXS6vbrDAElg.text: My husband and I were in Charlotte for a conference, and we were looking for a restaurant to celebrate our anniversary. We chose Fleming's Prime Steakhouse. I made reservations through Yelp and mentioned that it was our anniversary. When we arrived, the Hostess wished us a happy Anniversary and showed us to our table. There was an anniversary card and a few glittery decorations on our table. Several of the staff wished us happy anniversary as well. Our server was amazing. He went out of his way to make our evening special. The food was amazing from start to finish. I would go back in a heartbeat. Thank you so much for an amazing night!

photos.caption: Photo of Fleming's Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Small Seafood Tower and French Onion Soup

iHTEn7QDyZFhFI8yFhxFrg.text: The hubby and I chose to celebrate the 10 year anniversary of our first date at Flemings.  We initially chose the location because we had a Dine Rewards incentive available and we thought we'd try something new with that reward.  This was our first experience dining at Fleming's.  I loved that they had our table decorated with gold confetti and an Anniversary Card.  Our waiters, Jose and Larry, were personable, friendly, and in general, just awesome!  We started the night with a couple of cocktails.  The hubby had the Old Fashioned ($14) which featured "Basil Hayden bourbon, aromas of orange peel, layered with sweet toasted vanilla".  I decided to try a bourbon cocktail that I had never experienced before--you know, to extend the bourbon palate. I'm always excited to find new ways to incorporate bourbon.  So I ordered the Royale Pal ($14) which featured "Templeton Rye, Dolin Blanc & Aperol with a hint of strawberry".  The Old Fashioned was absolutely perfect and balanced between the bourbon, citrus, and vanilla.  I didn't hate my Royale Pal, but it definitely underwhelmed me.  The bourbon just didn't stand out against the other flavors, which I found odd given that the cocktail utilized a Rye-based bourbon.  To make up for it, we ordered a second round later, both of which were Old Fashioned's!  For our dinner, we elected to indulge in the Tomahawk Tuesday special ($120) which included two salads, two sides and a Tomahawk steak to share, and two desserts.  I chose the Caesar and the hubby chose the Wedge.  Both were generously portioned and quite delicious.  My Caesar was created with coarsely chopped lettuce and parmesan, which I'll be honest, I didn't prefer.  My preference for this style of salad is that the lettuce to be chopped into smaller bite-size pieces, and I find that parmesan flavor blooms better in this salad when it is grated instead of shaven, but I realize that's just my personal preference.  My dressing was well-balanced for a classic Caesar and I could detect the subtle hint of anchovy, which I always expect in a good Caesar dressing. For our sides, we chose the Crispy Brussels Sprouts and Bacon and the North Atlantic Lobster Macaroni & Cheese.  Can I just insert in here that I have a love/hate relationship with knowing the calories in my food?  I would never have guessed that the Mac & Cheese had 1710 calories had it not been on the menu.  It was a special occasion and sounded freaking amazing so we ordered it anyway.  Seeing that number calories on the menu did not spark joy for me, but let me tell you the flavor of that mac & cheese absolutely did!!!  Worth. Every. Darn. Calorie.  It was creamy with a lightly smoked flavor but it also a tiny bit tangy at the back of the palate. It was heavenly.... what more can I say?  If you dine here, order it.  You won't regret it.  Moving on... for dessert we had the Molten Lava Cake and Creme Brulee.  We didn't need to see the menu to choose desserts, so I didn't have to look at the calories (TG!).  Jose delighted us by lighting some Grand Marnier and pouring it over the Lava Cake tableside.  You really can't go wrong with chocolate cake or creme brulee, but I thought the presentation of both desserts was outstanding.  Overall, Flemings earned a solid 5 stars and I won't hesitate to come here again the next time we are celebrating a milestone!!

photos.caption: Photo of Fleming's Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Molten Lava Cake with Grand Marnier

-iKNu0qpfoHf8UHEVsiEXA.text: I was pleasantly surprised by this restaurant. I usually try to stay away from chain restaurants. However, my wife and I wanted to try a restaurant we haven't been to for restaurant week. It was a great experience! We had an amazing waiter (Jessie). He asked us if we had any food allergies (a few times) which I have never had before. He didn't rush us which I feel normally happens during restaurant week. We were able to really enjoy our meal and our bottle of wine which Jessie helped us pick. We were deciding between a few bottles and suggested a different one which we ended up getting as my wife preferred that one.   The food was perfect. We had the soup, steak and cheesecake for dessert. Both of our steaks were cooked as we asked. the one down side was the amount of blueberry sauce I had on my cheesecake. My wife joked about it to Jessie and he brought me more. It was a very nice of him.   I believe we will come back the next time we are looking for a steak dinner. Thank you for making our first time memorable.

JEzudz4Yn-9leoACK98tOg.text: My review is based on what little "service" my family and I received. We didn't get to eat. There are 5 of us, my husband and I and our 3 kids, 12, 7 and 5. We were just trying to find somewhere close to our hotel with good yelp ratings to eat because we were starving but we also like to eat well.  We walked in and I waited for another gentleman to finish his request for a table. I told the young man at the podium that there were 5 of us and he said it would just be a couple minutes for a table (we could see empty tables). He and another young lady seated some people with reservations and he came back to the podium and looked at us again (we were the only ones there). He got on the phone, spoke quietly and then told us that never mind, they didn't have any tables for at least 20-30 minutes.   We were pretty offended because we felt like there was some judgement going on (kids? Underdressed?) I'm not sure but It seemed shady and we were all getting hangry.   Lucky for us, we walked across the street to a place with a better health rating and food that my family are all happy with.

gm_mGKetl2WyXq1VeC4IBg.text: They can't get 5 stars as there's no validation of parking and I could have sworn there used to be but hey... whatever.   At any rate, make it a date night and go to the SMG movies as they still validate.   If you're using elevators from the parking they are on the 1st level.   I can't recommend our server Amanda tonight. She's not horrible was just a bit off putting for me. And she swore I didn't tell her to apply the dine rewards nor can she see it.   I'm like (1) every other sister restaurant can see it as they offer it and (2) maybe if she wasn't quick to run off she would have heard me clearly state I have 2 promos please use 1 and here's my number. Why else would I write my number on the check?!?!?  Happy hour is still decent since it is offered on weekends as well.   Steak + Lobster is still $50 until mid April.   Steak + King Crab is $59 until May 1st.   $20 gift card bonus promo until May something. Bonus card eligible for use May 14th on.   Worth going if you're walking. On the train. Or already got a parking comp.

0MR9NS99izj3IviRj_Au6A.text: Flemings is one those places that is good but not great. It isn't because the service but rather the prices for the quality. I feel like the quality is good and much better than anything you are going to get in the store but the prices are steep for comparable steakhouses.   I would rather go to Del Frisco or Sullivan's before going back to Flemings. The season or flavor of the steak was simply okay comparable to a more rich texture of Del Frisco. I always order my steaks medium rare and I love the taste because it is the most flavorful at that point to me.  As I got the lobster and steak special they run and it was decent.   I don't remember leaving here thinking oh I am dying to go back but I didn't leave there unsatisfied.  I am in no rush to come back here but I would recommend a try.   You may have a different experience but I can't complain. I just wanted great and got good.

photos.caption: Photo of Fleming's Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States

JnjRkzPOepEmruaRVLScvg.text: Fleming's Prime Steakhouse was very delicious and the customer service was great also. I really love crab cakes and the ones here are phenomenal. Expect to enjoy a nice ambiance and even better food.

R55ISpL2B8hW2UnQjELLaQ.text: This was my second time experiencing Fleming's... and it was unbelievably great! The bone in Filet was probably the best steak I have ever had in my life. Fat, juicy and super flavorful. My end bill was a little pricy but I expected it to be so no issues there... I'll choose Fleming's over Ruth Chris and Chimas anyday. 5 star rating.

Yz1vT2CTw8-eh2HyfXgRPg.text: The food at Fleming's was great. They have the same menu as other Fleming's, so if you've been to one before you know it's good. The reason for 4 stars is due to the service. Our waiter was very nice but forgot to bring us bread and forgot to bring drinks we ordered.  We would go back, but there are other restaurants and steakhouses uptown that provide better service.

6g9gjosWVnofOpaJFLudQg.text: Fleming's food is always AMAZING! I'd recommend the Price Dry-Aged Ribeye (cooked medium), Chipotle Cheddar Mac & Cheese, and the Crispy Brussels Spouts & Bacon... the sides are sharable for the table (just as they are for most of your $$$+ restaurants like The Capital Grille for example).   Our first visit to Fleming's was in January 2018 for my birthday, which is during Restaurant Week. We were so impressed that we went back for Valentines Day AND on our engagement day! Yes, my fiance proposed to me at Fleming's and the Fleming's staff helped make my engagement the best engagement ever! My fiance worked with the manager who helped make everything possible. They worked with him with all of the details even allowed the flowers to be delivered there and they stored them properly for us.   As soon as my fiance proposed Flemings gave us complimentary chocolate, wine, cheesecake, took our picture, developed it, and put it in a frame. My fiance then had a horse and carriage ride planned and the staff a Fleming's held on to our personal items and our leftovers for us.  They were sooo accommodating, I am forever grateful! We are literally heading to Fleming's tonight for our Anniversary! Fleming's will forever be a place that we celebrate special occasions.

gE4KAtlSiG4D3tfqwK3S7A.text: The service and meal itself was excellent! Our filets were cooked perfectly and our sides were delicious, especially the brussel sprouts.   As our dessert were being, served a group of five shabbily dressed very drunk men entered the bar - we were seated in the dining room but with a view into the bar. There wasn't room in a booth for them in the bar, so they were seated at a round table near us. Their language was extremely offensive and I can't imagine the the manager on staff or manager at all of Fleming's would approve of this type if customer in their restaurant.   During the course of the evening we witnessed a family with two small children across from (thankfully they had left) and a marriage proposal. It was a wonderful evening - until these drunk men walked through the door. They ruined a perfectly wonderful atmosphere.

V5VFjNIMAd9OrzH00Vnu6g.text: I stopped in Fleming's tonight in Charlotte for the first time on a business trip. We had a great dinner at the bar with our bartender Harley. An amazing dining experience was made even better by the stupendous service from Harley.   Next time in town I will be back.

aTkrXVazwI_5QMbvKBrK2A.text: Delicious food and impeccable service. My husband took me here for my birthday and we received top notch service.  No complaints, I highly recommend.

U7TuiYBVG5pVQqJIPVz0mA.text: The staff is amazing! Welcoming, unpretentious, attentive, easy-going. If I had known their service was this chill I wouldn't came a long time ago. And of course the steak was perfectly seasoned and cooked.
